content: 1 After the death of Moses the servant of the LORD, the LORD said to Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ attendant:
content_old: 1 After the death of Moses the servant of the LORD, the LORD said to Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ attendant:

content: 2 “My servant Moses is dead. Prepare to cross the Jordan, together with all this people, into the land that I am giving to the Israelites.
content_old: 2 “My servant Moses is dead. Prepare to cross the Jordan, together with all this people, into the land that I am giving to the Israelites.

content: 3 Every spot on which your foot treads I give to you, as I promised Moses.
content_old: 3 Every spot on which your foot treads I give to you, as I promised Moses.

content: 4 Your territory shall extend from the wilderness and the Lebanon to the Great River, the River Euphrateson the east—the whole Hittite country—and up to the Mediterranean Sea on the west.
content_old: 4 Your territory shall extend from the wilderness and the Lebanon to the Great River, the River Euphrateson the east—the whole Hittite country—and up to the Mediterranean Sea on the west.

content: 5 No one shall be able to resist you as long as you live. As I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will not fail you or forsake you.
content_old: 5 No one shall be able to resist you as long as you live. As I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will not fail you or forsake you.

content: 6 “Be strong and resolute, for you shall apportion to this people the land that I swore to their fathers to assign to them.
content_old: 6 “Be strong and resolute, for you shall apportion to this people the land that I swore to their fathers to assign to them.

content: 7 But you must be very strong and resolute to observe faithfully all the Teaching that My servant Moses enjoined upon you. Do not deviate from it to the right or to the left, that you may be successful wherever you go.
content_old: 7 But you must be very strong and resolute to observe faithfully all the Teaching that My servant Moses enjoined upon you. Do not deviate from it to the right or to the left, that you may be successful wherever you go.

content: 8 Let not this Book of the Teaching cease from your lips, but recite it day and night, so that you may observe faithfully all that is written in it. Only then will you prosper in your undertakings and only then will you be successful.
content_old: 8 Let not this Book of the Teaching cease from your lips, but recite it day and night, so that you may observe faithfully all that is written in it. Only then will you prosper in your undertakings and only then will you be successful.

content: 9 “I charge you: Be strong and resolute; do not be terrified or dismayed, for the LORD your God is with you wherever you go.”
content_old: 9 “I charge you: Be strong and resolute; do not be terrified or dismayed, for the LORD your God is with you wherever you go.”

content: 10 Joshua thereupon gave orders to the officials of the people:
content_old: 10 Joshua thereupon gave orders to the officials of the people:

content: 11 “Go through the camp and charge the people thus: Get provisions ready, for in three days’ time you are to cross the Jordan, in order to enter and possess the land that the LORD your God is giving you as a possession.”
content_old: 11 “Go through the camp and charge the people thus: Get provisions ready, for in three days’ time you are to cross the Jordan, in order to enter and possess the land that the LORD your God is giving you as a possession.”

content: 12 Then Joshua said to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,
content_old: 12 Then Joshua said to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,

content: 13 “Remember what Moses the servant of the LORD enjoined upon you, when he said: ‘The LORD your God is granting you a haven; He has assigned this territory to you.’
content_old: 13 “Remember what Moses the servant of the LORD enjoined upon you, when he said: ‘The LORD your God is granting you a haven; He has assigned this territory to you.’

content: 14 Let your wives, children, and livestock remain in the land that Moses assigned to you on this side of the Jordan; but every one of your fighting men shall go across armed in the van of your kinsmen. And you shall assist them
content_old: 14 Let your wives, children, and livestock remain in the land that Moses assigned to you on this side of the Jordan; but every one of your fighting men shall go across armed in the van of your kinsmen. And you shall assist them

content: 15 until the LORD has given your kinsmen a haven, such as you have, and they too have gained possession of the land that the LORD your God has assigned to them. Then you may return to the land on the east side of the Jordan, which Moses the servant of the LORD assigned to you as your possession, and you may possess it.”
content_old: 15 until the LORD has given your kinsmen a haven, such as you have, and they too have gained possession of the land that the LORD your God has assigned to them. Then you may return to the land on the east side of the Jordan, which Moses the servant of the LORD assigned to you as your possession, and you may possess it.”

content: 16 They answered Joshua, “We will do everything you have commanded us and we will go wherever you send us.
content_old: 16 They answered Joshua, “We will do everything you have commanded us and we will go wherever you send us.

content: 17 We will obey you just as we obeyed Moses; let but the LORD your God be with you as He was with Moses!
content_old: 17 We will obey you just as we obeyed Moses; let but the LORD your God be with you as He was with Moses!

content: 1 Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two spies from Shittim, saying, “Go, reconnoiter the region of Jericho.” So they set out, and they came to the house of a harlot named Rahab and lodged there.
content_old: 1 Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two spies from Shittim, saying, “Go, reconnoiter the region of Jericho.” So they set out, and they came to the house of a harlot named Rahab and lodged there.

content: 2 The king of Jericho was told, “Some men have come here tonight, Israelites, to spy out the country.”
content_old: 2 The king of Jericho was told, “Some men have come here tonight, Israelites, to spy out the country.”

content: 3 The king of Jericho thereupon sent orders to Rahab: “Produce the men who came to you and entered your house, for they have come to spy out the whole country.”
content_old: 3 The king of Jericho thereupon sent orders to Rahab: “Produce the men who came to you and entered your house, for they have come to spy out the whole country.”

content: 4 The woman, however, had taken the two men and hidden them. “It is true,” she said, “the men did come to me, but I didn’t know where they were from.
content_old: 4 The woman, however, had taken the two men and hidden them. “It is true,” she said, “the men did come to me, but I didn’t know where they were from.

content: 5 And at dark, when the gate was about to be closed, the men left; and I don’t know where the men went. Quick, go after them, for you can overtake them.”—
content_old: 5 And at dark, when the gate was about to be closed, the men left; and I don’t know where the men went. Quick, go after them, for you can overtake them.”—

content: 6 Now she had taken them up to the roof and hidden them under some stalks of flax which she had lying on the roof.—
content_old: 6 Now she had taken them up to the roof and hidden them under some stalks of flax which she had lying on the roof.—

content: 7 So the men pursued them in the direction of the Jordan down to the fords; and no sooner had the pursuers gone out than the gate was shut behind them.
content_old: 7 So the men pursued them in the direction of the Jordan down to the fords; and no sooner had the pursuers gone out than the gate was shut behind them.

content: 8 The spies had not yet gone to sleep when she came up to them on the roof.
content_old: 8 The spies had not yet gone to sleep when she came up to them on the roof.

content: 9 She said to the men, “I know that the LORD has given the country to you, because dread of you has fallen upon us, and all the inhabitants of the land are quaking before you.
content_old: 9 She said to the men, “I know that the LORD has given the country to you, because dread of you has fallen upon us, and all the inhabitants of the land are quaking before you.

content: 10 For we have heard how the LORD dried up the waters of the Sea of Reeds for you when you left Egypt, and what you did to Sihon and Og, the two Amorite kings across the Jordan, whom you doomed.
content_old: 10 For we have heard how the LORD dried up the waters of the Sea of Reeds for you when you left Egypt, and what you did to Sihon and Og, the two Amorite kings across the Jordan, whom you doomed.

content: 11 When we heard about it, we lost heart, and no man had any more spirit left because of you; for the LORD your God is the only God in heaven above and on earth below.
content_old: 11 When we heard about it, we lost heart, and no man had any more spirit left because of you; for the LORD your God is the only God in heaven above and on earth below.

content: 12 Now, since I have shown loyalty to you, swear to me by the LORD that you in turn will show loyalty to my family. Provide me with a reliable sign
content_old: 12 Now, since I have shown loyalty to you, swear to me by the LORD that you in turn will show loyalty to my family. Provide me with a reliable sign

content: 13 that you will spare the lives of my father and mother, my brothers and sisters, and all who belong to them, and save us from death.”
content_old: 13 that you will spare the lives of my father and mother, my brothers and sisters, and all who belong to them, and save us from death.”

content: 14 The men answered her, “Our persons are pledged for yours, even to death! If you do not disclose this mission of ours, we will show you true loyalty when the LORD gives us the land.”
content_old: 14 The men answered her, “Our persons are pledged for yours, even to death! If you do not disclose this mission of ours, we will show you true loyalty when the LORD gives us the land.”

content: 15 She let them down by a rope through the window—for her dwelling was at the outer side of the city wall and she lived in the actual wall.
content_old: 15 She let them down by a rope through the window—for her dwelling was at the outer side of the city wall and she lived in the actual wall.

content: 16 She said to them, “Make for the hills, so that the pursuers may not come upon you. Stay there in hiding three days, until the pursuers return; then go your way.”
content_old: 16 She said to them, “Make for the hills, so that the pursuers may not come upon you. Stay there in hiding three days, until the pursuers return; then go your way.”

content: 17 But the men warned her, “We will be released from this oath which you have made us take
content_old: 17 But the men warned her, “We will be released from this oath which you have made us take

content: 18 when we invade the country, you tie this length of crimson cord to the window through which you let us down. Bring your father, your mother, your brothers, and all your family together in your house;
content_old: 18 when we invade the country, you tie this length of crimson cord to the window through which you let us down. Bring your father, your mother, your brothers, and all your family together in your house;

content: 19 and if anyone ventures outside the doors of your house, his blood will be on his head, and we shall be clear. But if a hand is laid on anyone who remains in the house with you, his blood shall be on our heads.
content_old: 19 and if anyone ventures outside the doors of your house, his blood will be on his head, and we shall be clear. But if a hand is laid on anyone who remains in the house with you, his blood shall be on our heads.

content: 20 And if you disclose this mission of ours, we shall likewise be released from the oath which you made us take.”
content_old: 20 And if you disclose this mission of ours, we shall likewise be released from the oath which you made us take.”

content: 21 She replied, “Let it be as you say.” She sent them on their way, and they left; and she tied the crimson cord to the window.
content_old: 21 She replied, “Let it be as you say.” She sent them on their way, and they left; and she tied the crimson cord to the window.

content: 22 They went straight to the hills and stayed there three days, until the pursuers turned back. And so the pursuers, searching all along the road, did not find them.
content_old: 22 They went straight to the hills and stayed there three days, until the pursuers turned back. And so the pursuers, searching all along the road, did not find them.

content: 23 Then the two men came down again from the hills and crossed over. They came to Joshua son of Nun and reported to him all that had happened to them.
content_old: 23 Then the two men came down again from the hills and crossed over. They came to Joshua son of Nun and reported to him all that had happened to them.

content: 1 Early next morning, Joshua and all the Israelites set out from Shittim and marched to the Jordan. They did not cross immediately, but spent the night there.
content_old: 1 Early next morning, Joshua and all the Israelites set out from Shittim and marched to the Jordan. They did not cross immediately, but spent the night there.

content: 2 Three days later, the officials went through the camp
content_old: 2 Three days later, the officials went through the camp

content: 3 and charged the people as follows: “When you see the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD your God being borne by the levitical priests, you shall move forward. Follow it—
content_old: 3 and charged the people as follows: “When you see the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD your God being borne by the levitical priests, you shall move forward. Follow it—

content: 4 but keep a distance of some two thousand cubits from it, never coming any closer to it—so that you may know by what route to march, since it is a road you have not traveled before.”
content_old: 4 but keep a distance of some two thousand cubits from it, never coming any closer to it—so that you may know by what route to march, since it is a road you have not traveled before.”

content: 5 And Joshua said to the people, “Purify yourselves, for tomorrow the LORD will perform wonders in your midst.”
content_old: 5 And Joshua said to the people, “Purify yourselves, for tomorrow the LORD will perform wonders in your midst.”

content: 6 Then Joshua ordered the priests, “Take up the Ark of the Covenant and advance to the head of the people.” And they took up the Ark of the Covenant and marched at the head of the people.
content_old: 6 Then Joshua ordered the priests, “Take up the Ark of the Covenant and advance to the head of the people.” And they took up the Ark of the Covenant and marched at the head of the people.

content: 7 The LORD said to Joshua, “This day, for the first time, I will exalt you in the sight of all Israel, so that they shall know that I will be with you as I was with Moses.
content_old: 7 The LORD said to Joshua, “This day, for the first time, I will exalt you in the sight of all Israel, so that they shall know that I will be with you as I was with Moses.

content: 8 For your part, command the priests who carry the Ark of the Covenant as follows: When you reach the edge of the waters of the Jordan, make a halt in the Jordan.”
content_old: 8 For your part, command the priests who carry the Ark of the Covenant as follows: When you reach the edge of the waters of the Jordan, make a halt in the Jordan.”

content: 9 And Joshua said to the Israelites, “Come closer and listen to the words of the LORD your God.
content_old: 9 And Joshua said to the Israelites, “Come closer and listen to the words of the LORD your God.

content: 10 By this,” Joshua continued, “you shall know that a living God is among you, and that He will dispossess for you the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites, and Jebusites:
content_old: 10 By this,” Joshua continued, “you shall know that a living God is among you, and that He will dispossess for you the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites, and Jebusites:

content: 11 the Ark of the Covenant of the Sovereign of all the earth is advancing before you into the Jordan.
content_old: 11 the Ark of the Covenant of the Sovereign of all the earth is advancing before you into the Jordan.

content: 12 Now select twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one man from each tribe.
content_old: 12 Now select twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one man from each tribe.

content: 13 When the feet of the priests bearing the Ark of the LORD, the Sovereign of all the earth, come to rest in the waters of the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan—the water coming from upstream—will be cut off and will stand in a single heap.”
content_old: 13 When the feet of the priests bearing the Ark of the LORD, the Sovereign of all the earth, come to rest in the waters of the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan—the water coming from upstream—will be cut off and will stand in a single heap.”

content: 14 When the people set out from their encampment to cross the Jordan, the priests bearing the Ark of the Covenant were at the head of the people.
content_old: 14 When the people set out from their encampment to cross the Jordan, the priests bearing the Ark of the Covenant were at the head of the people.

content: 15 Now the Jordan keeps flowing over its entire bed throughout the harvest season. But as soon as the bearers of the Ark reached the Jordan, and the feet of the priests bearing the Ark dipped into the water at its edge,
content_old: 15 Now the Jordan keeps flowing over its entire bed throughout the harvest season. But as soon as the bearers of the Ark reached the Jordan, and the feet of the priests bearing the Ark dipped into the water at its edge,

content: 16 the waters coming down from upstream piled up in a single heap a great way off, at Adam, the town next to Zarethan; and those flowing away downstream to the Sea of the Arabah the Dead Sea ran out completely. So the people crossed near Jericho.
content_old: 16 the waters coming down from upstream piled up in a single heap a great way off, at Adam, the town next to Zarethan; and those flowing away downstream to the Sea of the Arabah the Dead Sea ran out completely. So the people crossed near Jericho.

content: 1 When the entire nation had finished crossing the Jordan, the LORD said to Joshua,
content_old: 1 When the entire nation had finished crossing the Jordan, the LORD said to Joshua,

content: 2 “Select twelve men from among the people, one from each tribe,
content_old: 2 “Select twelve men from among the people, one from each tribe,

content: 3 and instruct them as follows: Pick up twelve stones from the spot exactly in the middle of the Jordan, where the priests’ feet are standing; take them along with you and deposit them in the place where you will spend the night.”
content_old: 3 and instruct them as follows: Pick up twelve stones from the spot exactly in the middle of the Jordan, where the priests’ feet are standing; take them along with you and deposit them in the place where you will spend the night.”

content: 4 Joshua summoned the twelve men whom he had designated among the Israelites, one from each tribe;
content_old: 4 Joshua summoned the twelve men whom he had designated among the Israelites, one from each tribe;

content: 5 and Joshua said to them, “Walk up to the Ark of the LORD your God, in the middle of the Jordan, and each of you lift a stone onto his shoulder—corresponding to the number of the tribes of Israel.
content_old: 5 and Joshua said to them, “Walk up to the Ark of the LORD your God, in the middle of the Jordan, and each of you lift a stone onto his shoulder—corresponding to the number of the tribes of Israel.

content: 6 This shall serve as a symbol among you: in time to come, when your children ask, ‘What is the meaning of these stones for you?’
content_old: 6 This shall serve as a symbol among you: in time to come, when your children ask, ‘What is the meaning of these stones for you?’

content: 7 you shall tell them, ‘The waters of the Jordan were cut off because of the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant; when it passed through the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off.’ And so these stones shall serve the people of Israel as a memorial for all time.”
content_old: 7 you shall tell them, ‘The waters of the Jordan were cut off because of the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant; when it passed through the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off.’ And so these stones shall serve the people of Israel as a memorial for all time.”

content: 8 The Israelites did as Joshua ordered. They picked up twelve stones, corresponding to the number of the tribes of Israel, from the middle of the Jordan—as the LORD had charged Joshua—and they took them along with them to their night encampment and deposited them there.
content_old: 8 The Israelites did as Joshua ordered. They picked up twelve stones, corresponding to the number of the tribes of Israel, from the middle of the Jordan—as the LORD had charged Joshua—and they took them along with them to their night encampment and deposited them there.

content: 9 Joshua also set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan, at the spot where the feet of the priests bearing the Ark of the Covenant had stood; and they have remained there to this day.
content_old: 9 Joshua also set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan, at the spot where the feet of the priests bearing the Ark of the Covenant had stood; and they have remained there to this day.

content: 10 The priests who bore the Ark remained standing in the middle of the Jordan until all the instructions that the LORD had ordered Joshua to convey to the people had been carried out. And so the people speedily crossed over, just as Moses had assured Joshua in his charge to him.
content_old: 10 The priests who bore the Ark remained standing in the middle of the Jordan until all the instructions that the LORD had ordered Joshua to convey to the people had been carried out. And so the people speedily crossed over, just as Moses had assured Joshua in his charge to him.

content: 11 And when all the people finished crossing, the Ark of the LORD and the priests advanced to the head of the people.
content_old: 11 And when all the people finished crossing, the Ark of the LORD and the priests advanced to the head of the people.

content: 12 The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh went across armed in the van of the Israelites, as Moses had charged them.
content_old: 12 The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh went across armed in the van of the Israelites, as Moses had charged them.

content: 13 About forty thousand shock troops went across, at the instance of the LORD, to the steppes of Jericho for battle.
content_old: 13 About forty thousand shock troops went across, at the instance of the LORD, to the steppes of Jericho for battle.

content: 14 On that day the LORD exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel, so that they revered him all his days as they had revered Moses.
content_old: 14 On that day the LORD exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel, so that they revered him all his days as they had revered Moses.

content: 15 The LORD said to Joshua,
content_old: 15 The LORD said to Joshua,

content: 16 “Command the priests who bear the Ark of the Pact to come up out of the Jordan.”
content_old: 16 “Command the priests who bear the Ark of the Pact to come up out of the Jordan.”

content: 17 So Joshua commanded the priests, “Come up out of the Jordan.”
content_old: 17 So Joshua commanded the priests, “Come up out of the Jordan.”

content: 18 As soon as the priests who bore the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant came up out of the Jordan, and the feet of the priests stepped onto the dry ground, the waters of the Jordan resumed their course, flowing over its entire bed as before.
content_old: 18 As soon as the priests who bore the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant came up out of the Jordan, and the feet of the priests stepped onto the dry ground, the waters of the Jordan resumed their course, flowing over its entire bed as before.

content: 19 The people came up from the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and encamped at Gilgal on the eastern border of Jericho.
content_old: 19 The people came up from the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and encamped at Gilgal on the eastern border of Jericho.

content: 20 And Joshua set up in Gilgal the twelve stones they had taken from the Jordan.
content_old: 20 And Joshua set up in Gilgal the twelve stones they had taken from the Jordan.

content: 21 He charged the Israelites as follows: “In time to come, when your children ask their fathers, ‘What is the meaning of those stones?’
content_old: 21 He charged the Israelites as follows: “In time to come, when your children ask their fathers, ‘What is the meaning of those stones?’

content: 22 tell your children: ‘Here the Israelites crossed the Jordan on dry land.’
content_old: 22 tell your children: ‘Here the Israelites crossed the Jordan on dry land.’

content: 23 For the LORD your God dried up the waters of the Jordan before you until you crossed, just as the LORD your God did to the Sea of Reeds, which He dried up before us until we crossed.
content_old: 23 For the LORD your God dried up the waters of the Jordan before you until you crossed, just as the LORD your God did to the Sea of Reeds, which He dried up before us until we crossed.

content: 1 When all the kings of the Amorites on the western side of the Jordan, and all the kings of the Canaanites near the Sea, heard how the LORD had dried up the waters of the Jordan for the sake of the Israelites until they crossed over, they lost heart, and no spirit was left in them because of the Israelites.
content_old: 1 When all the kings of the Amorites on the western side of the Jordan, and all the kings of the Canaanites near the Sea, heard how the LORD had dried up the waters of the Jordan for the sake of the Israelites until they crossed over, they lost heart, and no spirit was left in them because of the Israelites.

content: 2 At that time the LORD said to Joshua, “Make flint knives and proceed with a second circumcision of the Israelites.”
content_old: 2 At that time the LORD said to Joshua, “Make flint knives and proceed with a second circumcision of the Israelites.”

content: 3 So Joshua had flint knives made, and the Israelites were circumcised at Gibeath-haaraloth.
content_old: 3 So Joshua had flint knives made, and the Israelites were circumcised at Gibeath-haaraloth.

content: 4 This is the reason why Joshua had the circumcision performed: All the people who had come out of Egypt, all the males of military age, had died during the desert wanderings after leaving Egypt.
content_old: 4 This is the reason why Joshua had the circumcision performed: All the people who had come out of Egypt, all the males of military age, had died during the desert wanderings after leaving Egypt.

content: 5 Now, whereas all the people who came out of Egypt had been circumcised, none of the people born after the exodus, during the desert wanderings, had been circumcised.
content_old: 5 Now, whereas all the people who came out of Egypt had been circumcised, none of the people born after the exodus, during the desert wanderings, had been circumcised.

content: 6 For the Israelites had traveled in the wilderness forty years, until the entire nation—the men of military age who had left Egypt—had perished; because they had not obeyed the LORD, and the LORD had sworn never to let them see the land that the LORD had sworn to their fathers to assign to us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
content_old: 6 For the Israelites had traveled in the wilderness forty years, until the entire nation—the men of military age who had left Egypt—had perished; because they had not obeyed the LORD, and the LORD had sworn never to let them see the land that the LORD had sworn to their fathers to assign to us, a land flowing with milk and honey.

content: 7 But He had raised up their sons in their stead; and it was these that Joshua circumcised, for they were uncircumcised, not having been circumcised on the way.
content_old: 7 But He had raised up their sons in their stead; and it was these that Joshua circumcised, for they were uncircumcised, not having been circumcised on the way.

content: 8 After the circumcising of the whole nation was completed, they remained where they were, in the camp, until they recovered.
content_old: 8 After the circumcising of the whole nation was completed, they remained where they were, in the camp, until they recovered.

content: 9 And the LORD said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away from you the disgrace of Egypt.” So that place was called Gilgal, as it still is.
content_old: 9 And the LORD said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away from you the disgrace of Egypt.” So that place was called Gilgal, as it still is.

content: 10 Encamped at Gilgal, in the steppes of Jericho, the Israelites offered the passover sacrifice on the fourteenth day of the month, toward evening.
content_old: 10 Encamped at Gilgal, in the steppes of Jericho, the Israelites offered the passover sacrifice on the fourteenth day of the month, toward evening.

content: 11 On the day after the passover offering, on that very day, they ate of the produce of the country, unleavened bread and parched grain.
content_old: 11 On the day after the passover offering, on that very day, they ate of the produce of the country, unleavened bread and parched grain.

content: 12 On that same day, when they ate of the produce of the land, the manna ceased. The Israelites got no more manna; that year they ate of the yield of the land of Canaan.
content_old: 12 On that same day, when they ate of the produce of the land, the manna ceased. The Israelites got no more manna; that year they ate of the yield of the land of Canaan.

content: 13 Once, when Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing before him, drawn sword in hand. Joshua went up to him and asked him, “Are you one of us or of our enemies?”
content_old: 13 Once, when Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing before him, drawn sword in hand. Joshua went up to him and asked him, “Are you one of us or of our enemies?”

content: 14 He replied, “No, I am captain of the LORD’s host. Now I have come!” Joshua threw himself face down to the ground and, prostrating himself, said to him, “What does my lord command his servant?”
content_old: 14 He replied, “No, I am captain of the LORD’s host. Now I have come!” Joshua threw himself face down to the ground and, prostrating himself, said to him, “What does my lord command his servant?”

content: 1 Now Jericho was shut up tight because of the Israelites; no one could leave or enter.
content_old: 1 Now Jericho was shut up tight because of the Israelites; no one could leave or enter.

content: 2 The LORD said to Joshua, “See, I will deliver Jericho and her king warriors into your hands.
content_old: 2 The LORD said to Joshua, “See, I will deliver Jericho and her king warriors into your hands.

content: 3 Let all your troops march around the city and complete one circuit of the city. Do this six days,
content_old: 3 Let all your troops march around the city and complete one circuit of the city. Do this six days,

content: 4 with seven priests carrying seven ram’s horns preceding the Ark. On the seventh day, march around the city seven times, with the priests blowing the horns.
content_old: 4 with seven priests carrying seven ram’s horns preceding the Ark. On the seventh day, march around the city seven times, with the priests blowing the horns.

content: 5 And when a long blast is sounded on the horn—as soon as you hear that sound of the horn—all the people shall give a mighty shout. Thereupon the city wall will collapse, and the people shall advance, every man straight ahead.”
content_old: 5 And when a long blast is sounded on the horn—as soon as you hear that sound of the horn—all the people shall give a mighty shout. Thereupon the city wall will collapse, and the people shall advance, every man straight ahead.”

content: 6 Joshua son of Nun summoned the priests and said to them, “Take up the Ark of the Covenant, and let seven priests carrying seven ram’s horns precede the Ark of the LORD.”
content_old: 6 Joshua son of Nun summoned the priests and said to them, “Take up the Ark of the Covenant, and let seven priests carrying seven ram’s horns precede the Ark of the LORD.”

content: 7 And he instructed the people, “Go forward, march around the city, with the vanguard marching in front of the Ark of the LORD.”
content_old: 7 And he instructed the people, “Go forward, march around the city, with the vanguard marching in front of the Ark of the LORD.”

content: 8 When Joshua had instructed the people, the seven priests carrying seven ram’s horns advanced before the LORD, blowing their horns; and the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant followed them.
content_old: 8 When Joshua had instructed the people, the seven priests carrying seven ram’s horns advanced before the LORD, blowing their horns; and the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant followed them.

content: 9 The vanguard marched in front of the priests who were blowing the horns, and the rear guard marched behind the Ark, with the horns sounding all the time.
content_old: 9 The vanguard marched in front of the priests who were blowing the horns, and the rear guard marched behind the Ark, with the horns sounding all the time.

content: 10 But Joshua’s orders to the rest of the people were, “Do not shout, do not let your voices be heard, and do not let a sound issue from your lips until the moment that I command you, ‘Shout!’ Then you shall shout.”
content_old: 10 But Joshua’s orders to the rest of the people were, “Do not shout, do not let your voices be heard, and do not let a sound issue from your lips until the moment that I command you, ‘Shout!’ Then you shall shout.”

content: 11 So he had the Ark of the LORD go around the city and complete one circuit; then they returned to camp and spent the night in camp.
content_old: 11 So he had the Ark of the LORD go around the city and complete one circuit; then they returned to camp and spent the night in camp.

content: 12 Joshua rose early the next day; and the priests took up the Ark of the LORD,
content_old: 12 Joshua rose early the next day; and the priests took up the Ark of the LORD,

content: 13 while the seven priests bearing the seven ram’s horns marched in front of the Ark of the LORD, blowing the horns as they marched. The vanguard marched in front of them, and the rear guard marched behind the Ark of the LORD, with the horns sounding all the time.
content_old: 13 while the seven priests bearing the seven ram’s horns marched in front of the Ark of the LORD, blowing the horns as they marched. The vanguard marched in front of them, and the rear guard marched behind the Ark of the LORD, with the horns sounding all the time.

content: 14 And so they marched around the city once on the second day and returned to the camp. They did this six days.
content_old: 14 And so they marched around the city once on the second day and returned to the camp. They did this six days.

content: 15 On the seventh day, they rose at daybreak and marched around the city, in the same manner, seven times; that was the only day that they marched around the city seven times.
content_old: 15 On the seventh day, they rose at daybreak and marched around the city, in the same manner, seven times; that was the only day that they marched around the city seven times.

content: 16 On the seventh round, as the priests blew the horns, Joshua commanded the people, “Shout! For the LORD has given you the city.
content_old: 16 On the seventh round, as the priests blew the horns, Joshua commanded the people, “Shout! For the LORD has given you the city.

content: 17 The city and everything in it are to be proscribed for the LORD; only Rahab the harlot is to be spared, and all who are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers we sent.
content_old: 17 The city and everything in it are to be proscribed for the LORD; only Rahab the harlot is to be spared, and all who are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers we sent.

content: 18 But you must beware of that which is proscribed, or else you will be proscribed: if you take anything from that which is proscribed, you will cause the camp of Israel to be proscribed; you will bring calamity upon it.
content_old: 18 But you must beware of that which is proscribed, or else you will be proscribed: if you take anything from that which is proscribed, you will cause the camp of Israel to be proscribed; you will bring calamity upon it.

content: 19 All the silver and gold and objects of copper and iron are consecrated to the LORD; they must go into the treasury of the LORD.”
content_old: 19 All the silver and gold and objects of copper and iron are consecrated to the LORD; they must go into the treasury of the LORD.”

content: 20 So the people shouted when the horns were sounded. When the people heard the sound of the horns, the people raised a mighty shout and the wall collapsed. The people rushed into the city, every man straight in front of him, and they captured the city.
content_old: 20 So the people shouted when the horns were sounded. When the people heard the sound of the horns, the people raised a mighty shout and the wall collapsed. The people rushed into the city, every man straight in front of him, and they captured the city.

content: 21 They exterminated everything in the city with the sword: man and woman, young and old, ox and sheep and ass.
content_old: 21 They exterminated everything in the city with the sword: man and woman, young and old, ox and sheep and ass.

content: 22 But Joshua bade the two men who had spied out the land, “Go into the harlot’s house and bring out the woman and all that belong to her, as you swore to her.”
content_old: 22 But Joshua bade the two men who had spied out the land, “Go into the harlot’s house and bring out the woman and all that belong to her, as you swore to her.”

content: 23 So the young spies went in and brought out Rahab, her father and her mother, her brothers and all that belonged to her—they brought out her whole family and left them outside the camp of Israel.
content_old: 23 So the young spies went in and brought out Rahab, her father and her mother, her brothers and all that belonged to her—they brought out her whole family and left them outside the camp of Israel.

content: 24 They burned down the city and everything in it. But the silver and gold and the objects of copper and iron were deposited in the treasury of the House of the LORD.
content_old: 24 They burned down the city and everything in it. But the silver and gold and the objects of copper and iron were deposited in the treasury of the House of the LORD.

content: 25 Only Rahab the harlot and her father’s family were spared by Joshua, along with all that belonged to her, and she dwelt among the Israelites—as is still the case. For she had hidden the messengers that Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
content_old: 25 Only Rahab the harlot and her father’s family were spared by Joshua, along with all that belonged to her, and she dwelt among the Israelites—as is still the case. For she had hidden the messengers that Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.

content: 26 At that time Joshua pronounced this oath: “Cursed of the LORD be the man who shall undertake to fortify this city of Jericho: he shall lay its foundations at the cost of his first-born, and set up its gates at the cost of his youngest.”
content_old: 26 At that time Joshua pronounced this oath: “Cursed of the LORD be the man who shall undertake to fortify this city of Jericho: he shall lay its foundations at the cost of his first-born, and set up its gates at the cost of his youngest.”

content: 1 The Israelites, however, violated the proscription: Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of that which was proscribed, and the LORD was incensed with the Israelites.
content_old: 1 The Israelites, however, violated the proscription: Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of that which was proscribed, and the LORD was incensed with the Israelites.

content: 2 Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which lies close to Beth-aven—east of Bethel—with orders to go up and spy out the country. So the men went up and spied out Ai.
content_old: 2 Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which lies close to Beth-aven—east of Bethel—with orders to go up and spy out the country. So the men went up and spied out Ai.

content: 3 They returned to Joshua and reported to him, “Not all the troops need go up. Let two or three thousand men go and attack Ai; do not trouble all the troops to go up there, for the people there are few.”
content_old: 3 They returned to Joshua and reported to him, “Not all the troops need go up. Let two or three thousand men go and attack Ai; do not trouble all the troops to go up there, for the people there are few.”

content: 4 So about three thousand of the troops marched up there; but they were routed by the men of Ai.
content_old: 4 So about three thousand of the troops marched up there; but they were routed by the men of Ai.

content: 5 The men of Ai killed about thirty-six of them, pursuing them outside the gate as far as Shebarim, and cutting them down along the descent. And the heart of the troops sank in utter dismay.
content_old: 5 The men of Ai killed about thirty-six of them, pursuing them outside the gate as far as Shebarim, and cutting them down along the descent. And the heart of the troops sank in utter dismay.

content: 6 Joshua thereupon rent his clothes. He and the elders of Israel lay until evening with their faces to the ground in front of the Ark of the LORD; and they strewed earth on their heads.
content_old: 6 Joshua thereupon rent his clothes. He and the elders of Israel lay until evening with their faces to the ground in front of the Ark of the LORD; and they strewed earth on their heads.

content: 7 “Ah, Lord GOD!” cried Joshua. “Why did You lead this people across the Jordan only to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites, to be destroyed by them? If only we had been content to remain on the other side of the Jordan!
content_old: 7 “Ah, Lord GOD!” cried Joshua. “Why did You lead this people across the Jordan only to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites, to be destroyed by them? If only we had been content to remain on the other side of the Jordan!

content: 8 O Lord, what can I say after Israel has turned tail before its enemies?
content_old: 8 O Lord, what can I say after Israel has turned tail before its enemies?

content: 9 When the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land hear of this, they will turn upon us and wipe out our very name from the earth. And what will You do about Your great name?”
content_old: 9 When the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land hear of this, they will turn upon us and wipe out our very name from the earth. And what will You do about Your great name?”

content: 10 But the LORD answered Joshua: “Arise! Why do you lie prostrate?
content_old: 10 But the LORD answered Joshua: “Arise! Why do you lie prostrate?

content: 11 Israel has sinned! They have broken the covenant by which I bound them. They have taken of the proscribed and put it in their vessels; they have stolen; they have broken faith!
content_old: 11 Israel has sinned! They have broken the covenant by which I bound them. They have taken of the proscribed and put it in their vessels; they have stolen; they have broken faith!

content: 12 Therefore, the Israelites will not be able to hold their ground against their enemies; they will have to turn tail before their enemies, for they have become proscribed. I will not be with you any more unless you root out from among you what is proscribed.
content_old: 12 Therefore, the Israelites will not be able to hold their ground against their enemies; they will have to turn tail before their enemies, for they have become proscribed. I will not be with you any more unless you root out from among you what is proscribed.

content: 13 Go and purify the people. Order them: Purify yourselves for tomorrow. For thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Something proscribed is in your midst, O Israel, and you will not be able to stand up to your enemies until you have purged the proscribed from among you.
content_old: 13 Go and purify the people. Order them: Purify yourselves for tomorrow. For thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Something proscribed is in your midst, O Israel, and you will not be able to stand up to your enemies until you have purged the proscribed from among you.

content: 14 Tomorrow morning you shall present yourselves by tribes. Whichever tribe the LORD indicates shall come forward by clans; the clan that the LORD indicates shall come forward by ancestral houses, and the ancestral house that the LORD indicates shall come forward man by man.
content_old: 14 Tomorrow morning you shall present yourselves by tribes. Whichever tribe the LORD indicates shall come forward by clans; the clan that the LORD indicates shall come forward by ancestral houses, and the ancestral house that the LORD indicates shall come forward man by man.

content: 15 Then he who is indicated for proscription, and all that is his, shall be put to the fire, because he broke the Covenant of the LORD and because he committed an outrage in Israel.”
content_old: 15 Then he who is indicated for proscription, and all that is his, shall be put to the fire, because he broke the Covenant of the LORD and because he committed an outrage in Israel.”

content: 16 Early next morning, Joshua had Israel come forward by tribes; and the tribe of Judah was indicated.
content_old: 16 Early next morning, Joshua had Israel come forward by tribes; and the tribe of Judah was indicated.

content: 17 He then had the clans of Judah come forward, and the clan of Zerah was indicated. Then he had the clan of Zerah come forward by ancestral houses, and Zabdi was indicated.
content_old: 17 He then had the clans of Judah come forward, and the clan of Zerah was indicated. Then he had the clan of Zerah come forward by ancestral houses, and Zabdi was indicated.

content: 18 Finally he had his ancestral house come forward man by man, and Achan son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was indicated.
content_old: 18 Finally he had his ancestral house come forward man by man, and Achan son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was indicated.

content: 19 Then Joshua said to Achan, “My son, pay honor to the LORD, the God of Israel, and make confession to Him. Tell me what you have done; do not hold anything back from me.”
content_old: 19 Then Joshua said to Achan, “My son, pay honor to the LORD, the God of Israel, and make confession to Him. Tell me what you have done; do not hold anything back from me.”

content: 20 Achan answered Joshua, “It is true, I have sinned against the LORD, the God of Israel. This is what I did:
content_old: 20 Achan answered Joshua, “It is true, I have sinned against the LORD, the God of Israel. This is what I did:

content: 21 I saw among the spoil a fine Shinar mantle, two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold weighing fifty shekels, and I coveted them and took them. They are buried in the ground in my tent, with the silver under it.”
content_old: 21 I saw among the spoil a fine Shinar mantle, two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold weighing fifty shekels, and I coveted them and took them. They are buried in the ground in my tent, with the silver under it.”

content: 22 Joshua sent messengers, who hurried to the tent; and there it was, buried in his tent, with the silver underneath.
content_old: 22 Joshua sent messengers, who hurried to the tent; and there it was, buried in his tent, with the silver underneath.

content: 23 They took them from the tent and brought them to Joshua and all the Israelites, and displayed them before the LORD.
content_old: 23 They took them from the tent and brought them to Joshua and all the Israelites, and displayed them before the LORD.

content: 24 Then Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan son of Zerah—and the silver, the mantle, and the wedge of gold—his sons and daughters, and his ox, his ass, and his flock, and his tent, and all his belongings, and brought them up to the Valley of Achor.
content_old: 24 Then Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan son of Zerah—and the silver, the mantle, and the wedge of gold—his sons and daughters, and his ox, his ass, and his flock, and his tent, and all his belongings, and brought them up to the Valley of Achor.

content: 25 And Joshua said, “What calamity you have brought upon us! The LORD will bring calamity upon you this day.” And all Israel pelted him with stones. They put them to the fire and stoned them.
content_old: 25 And Joshua said, “What calamity you have brought upon us! The LORD will bring calamity upon you this day.” And all Israel pelted him with stones. They put them to the fire and stoned them.

content: 1 The LORD said to Joshua, “Do not be frightened or dismayed. Take all the fighting troops with you, go and march against Ai. See, I will deliver the king of Ai, his people, his city, and his land into your hands.
content_old: 1 The LORD said to Joshua, “Do not be frightened or dismayed. Take all the fighting troops with you, go and march against Ai. See, I will deliver the king of Ai, his people, his city, and his land into your hands.

content: 2 You shall treat Ai and her king as you treated Jericho and her king; however, you may take the spoil and the cattle as booty for yourselves. Now set an ambush against the city behind it.”
content_old: 2 You shall treat Ai and her king as you treated Jericho and her king; however, you may take the spoil and the cattle as booty for yourselves. Now set an ambush against the city behind it.”

content: 3 So Joshua and all the fighting troops prepared for the march on Ai. Joshua chose thirty thousand men, valiant warriors, and sent them ahead by night.
content_old: 3 So Joshua and all the fighting troops prepared for the march on Ai. Joshua chose thirty thousand men, valiant warriors, and sent them ahead by night.

content: 4 He instructed them as follows: “Mind, you are to lie in ambush behind the city; don’t stay too far from the city, and all of you be on the alert.
content_old: 4 He instructed them as follows: “Mind, you are to lie in ambush behind the city; don’t stay too far from the city, and all of you be on the alert.

content: 5 I and all the troops with me will approach the city; and when they come out against us, as they did the first time, we will flee from them.
content_old: 5 I and all the troops with me will approach the city; and when they come out against us, as they did the first time, we will flee from them.

content: 6 They will come rushing after us until we have drawn them away from the city. They will think, ‘They are fleeing from us the same as last time’; but while we are fleeing before them,
content_old: 6 They will come rushing after us until we have drawn them away from the city. They will think, ‘They are fleeing from us the same as last time’; but while we are fleeing before them,

content: 7 you will dash out from your ambush and seize the city, and the LORD your God will deliver it into your hands.
content_old: 7 you will dash out from your ambush and seize the city, and the LORD your God will deliver it into your hands.

content: 8 And when you take the city, set it on fire. Do as the LORD has commanded. Mind, I have given you your orders.”
content_old: 8 And when you take the city, set it on fire. Do as the LORD has commanded. Mind, I have given you your orders.”

content: 9 Joshua then sent them off, and they proceeded to the ambush; they took up a position between Ai and Bethel—west of Ai—while Joshua spent the night with the rest of the troops.
content_old: 9 Joshua then sent them off, and they proceeded to the ambush; they took up a position between Ai and Bethel—west of Ai—while Joshua spent the night with the rest of the troops.

content: 10 Early in the morning, Joshua mustered the troops; then he and the elders of Israel marched upon Ai at the head of the troops.
content_old: 10 Early in the morning, Joshua mustered the troops; then he and the elders of Israel marched upon Ai at the head of the troops.

content: 11 All the fighting force that was with him advanced near the city and encamped to the north of Ai, with a hollow between them and Ai.—
content_old: 11 All the fighting force that was with him advanced near the city and encamped to the north of Ai, with a hollow between them and Ai.—

content: 12 He selected about five thousand men and stationed them as an ambush between Bethel and Ai, west of the city.
content_old: 12 He selected about five thousand men and stationed them as an ambush between Bethel and Ai, west of the city.

content: 13 Thus the main body of the army was disposed on the north of the city, but the far end of it was on the west. This was after Joshua had spent the night in the valley.—
content_old: 13 Thus the main body of the army was disposed on the north of the city, but the far end of it was on the west. This was after Joshua had spent the night in the valley.—

content: 14 When the king of Ai saw them, he and all his people, the inhabitants of the city, rushed out in the early morning to the meeting place, facing the Arabah, to engage the Israelites in battle; for he was unaware that a force was lying in ambush behind the city.
content_old: 14 When the king of Ai saw them, he and all his people, the inhabitants of the city, rushed out in the early morning to the meeting place, facing the Arabah, to engage the Israelites in battle; for he was unaware that a force was lying in ambush behind the city.

content: 15 Joshua and all Israel fled in the direction of the wilderness, as though routed by them.
content_old: 15 Joshua and all Israel fled in the direction of the wilderness, as though routed by them.

content: 16 All the troops in the city gathered to pursue them; pursuing Joshua, they were drawn out of the city.
content_old: 16 All the troops in the city gathered to pursue them; pursuing Joshua, they were drawn out of the city.

content: 17 Not a man was left in Ai or in Bethel who did not go out after Israel; they left the city open while they pursued Israel.
content_old: 17 Not a man was left in Ai or in Bethel who did not go out after Israel; they left the city open while they pursued Israel.

content: 18 The LORD then said to Joshua, “Hold out the javelin in your hand toward Ai, for I will deliver it into your hands.” So Joshua held out the javelin in his hand toward the city.
content_old: 18 The LORD then said to Joshua, “Hold out the javelin in your hand toward Ai, for I will deliver it into your hands.” So Joshua held out the javelin in his hand toward the city.

content: 19 As soon as he held out his hand, the ambush came rushing out of their station. They entered the city and captured it; and they swiftly set fire to the city.
content_old: 19 As soon as he held out his hand, the ambush came rushing out of their station. They entered the city and captured it; and they swiftly set fire to the city.

content: 20 The men of Ai looked back and saw the smoke of the city rising to the sky; they had no room for flight in any direction. The people who had been fleeing to the wilderness now became the pursuers.
content_old: 20 The men of Ai looked back and saw the smoke of the city rising to the sky; they had no room for flight in any direction. The people who had been fleeing to the wilderness now became the pursuers.

content: 21 For when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had captured the city, and that smoke was rising from the city, they turned around and attacked the men of Ai.
content_old: 21 For when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had captured the city, and that smoke was rising from the city, they turned around and attacked the men of Ai.

content: 22 Now the otherIsraelites were coming out of the city against them, so that they were between two bodies of Israelites, one on each side of them. They were slaughtered, so that no one escaped or got away.
content_old: 22 Now the otherIsraelites were coming out of the city against them, so that they were between two bodies of Israelites, one on each side of them. They were slaughtered, so that no one escaped or got away.

content: 23 The king of Ai was taken alive and brought to Joshua.
content_old: 23 The king of Ai was taken alive and brought to Joshua.

content: 24 When Israel had killed all the inhabitants of Ai who had pursued them into the open wilderness, and all of them, to the last man, had fallen by the sword, all the Israelites turned back to Ai and put it to the sword.
content_old: 24 When Israel had killed all the inhabitants of Ai who had pursued them into the open wilderness, and all of them, to the last man, had fallen by the sword, all the Israelites turned back to Ai and put it to the sword.

content: 25 The total of those who fell that day, men and women, the entire population of Ai, came to twelve thousand.
content_old: 25 The total of those who fell that day, men and women, the entire population of Ai, came to twelve thousand.

content: 26 Joshua did not draw back the hand with which he held out his javelin until all the inhabitants of Ai had been exterminated.
content_old: 26 Joshua did not draw back the hand with which he held out his javelin until all the inhabitants of Ai had been exterminated.

content: 27 However, the Israelites took the cattle and the spoil of the city as their booty, in accordance with the instructions that the LORD had given to Joshua.
content_old: 27 However, the Israelites took the cattle and the spoil of the city as their booty, in accordance with the instructions that the LORD had given to Joshua.

content: 28 Then Joshua burned down Ai, and turned it into a mound of ruins for all time, a desolation to this day.
content_old: 28 Then Joshua burned down Ai, and turned it into a mound of ruins for all time, a desolation to this day.

content: 29 And the king of Ai was impaled on a stake until the evening. At sunset, Joshua had the corpse taken down from the stake and it was left lying at the entrance to the city gate. They raised a great heap of stones over it, which is there to this day.
content_old: 29 And the king of Ai was impaled on a stake until the evening. At sunset, Joshua had the corpse taken down from the stake and it was left lying at the entrance to the city gate. They raised a great heap of stones over it, which is there to this day.

content: 30 At that time Joshua built an altar to the LORD, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal,
content_old: 30 At that time Joshua built an altar to the LORD, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal,

content: 31 as Moses, the servant of the LORD, had commanded the Israelites—as is written in the Book of the Teaching of Moses—an altar of unhewn stone upon which no iron had been wielded. They offered on it burnt offerings to the LORD, and brought sacrifices of well-being.
content_old: 31 as Moses, the servant of the LORD, had commanded the Israelites—as is written in the Book of the Teaching of Moses—an altar of unhewn stone upon which no iron had been wielded. They offered on it burnt offerings to the LORD, and brought sacrifices of well-being.

content: 32 And there, on the stones, he inscribed a copy of the Teaching that Moses had written for the Israelites.
content_old: 32 And there, on the stones, he inscribed a copy of the Teaching that Moses had written for the Israelites.

content: 33 All Israel—stranger and citizen alike—with their elders, officials, and magistrates, stood on either side of the Ark, facing the levitical priests who carried the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant. Half of them faced Mount Gerizim and half of them faced Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of the LORD had commanded them of old, in order to bless the people of Israel.
content_old: 33 All Israel—stranger and citizen alike—with their elders, officials, and magistrates, stood on either side of the Ark, facing the levitical priests who carried the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant. Half of them faced Mount Gerizim and half of them faced Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of the LORD had commanded them of old, in order to bless the people of Israel.

content: 34 After that, he read all the words of the Teaching, the blessing and the curse, just as is written in the Book of the Teaching.
content_old: 34 After that, he read all the words of the Teaching, the blessing and the curse, just as is written in the Book of the Teaching.

content: 1 When all the kings west of the Jordan—in the hill country, in the Shephelah, and along the entire coast of the Mediterranean Sea up to the vicinity of Lebanon, the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—learned of this,
content_old: 1 When all the kings west of the Jordan—in the hill country, in the Shephelah, and along the entire coast of the Mediterranean Sea up to the vicinity of Lebanon, the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—learned of this,

content: 2 they gathered with one accord to fight against Joshua and Israel.
content_old: 2 they gathered with one accord to fight against Joshua and Israel.

content: 3 But when the inhabitants of Gibeon learned how Joshua had treated Jericho and Ai,
content_old: 3 But when the inhabitants of Gibeon learned how Joshua had treated Jericho and Ai,

content: 4 they for their part resorted to cunning. They set out in disguise: they took worn-out sacks for their asses, and worn-out waterskins that were cracked and patched;
content_old: 4 they for their part resorted to cunning. They set out in disguise: they took worn-out sacks for their asses, and worn-out waterskins that were cracked and patched;

content: 5 they had worn-out, patched sandals on their feet, and threadbare clothes on their bodies; and all the bread they took as provision was dry and crumbly.
content_old: 5 they had worn-out, patched sandals on their feet, and threadbare clothes on their bodies; and all the bread they took as provision was dry and crumbly.

content: 6 And so they went to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal and said to him and to the men of Israel, “We come from a distant land; we propose that you make a pact with us.”
content_old: 6 And so they went to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal and said to him and to the men of Israel, “We come from a distant land; we propose that you make a pact with us.”

content: 7 The men of Israel replied to the Hivites, “But perhaps you live among us; how then can we make a pact with you?”
content_old: 7 The men of Israel replied to the Hivites, “But perhaps you live among us; how then can we make a pact with you?”

content: 8 They said to Joshua, “We will be your subjects.” But Joshua asked them, “Who are you and where do you come from?”
content_old: 8 They said to Joshua, “We will be your subjects.” But Joshua asked them, “Who are you and where do you come from?”

content: 9 They replied, “Your servants have come from a very distant country, because of the fame of the LORD your God. For we heard the report of Him: of all that He did in Egypt,
content_old: 9 They replied, “Your servants have come from a very distant country, because of the fame of the LORD your God. For we heard the report of Him: of all that He did in Egypt,

content: 10 and of all that He did to the two Amorite kings on the other side of the Jordan, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan who lived in Ashtaroth.
content_old: 10 and of all that He did to the two Amorite kings on the other side of the Jordan, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan who lived in Ashtaroth.

content: 11 So our elders and all the inhabitants of our country instructed us as follows, ‘Take along provisions for a trip, and go to them and say: We will be your subjects; come make a pact with us.’
content_old: 11 So our elders and all the inhabitants of our country instructed us as follows, ‘Take along provisions for a trip, and go to them and say: We will be your subjects; come make a pact with us.’

content: 12 This bread of ours, which we took from our houses as provision, was still hot when we set out to come to you; and see how dry and crumbly it has become.
content_old: 12 This bread of ours, which we took from our houses as provision, was still hot when we set out to come to you; and see how dry and crumbly it has become.

content: 13 These wineskins were new when we filled them, and see how they have cracked. These clothes and sandals of ours are worn out from the very long journey.”
content_old: 13 These wineskins were new when we filled them, and see how they have cracked. These clothes and sandals of ours are worn out from the very long journey.”

content: 14 The men took because of their provisions, and did not inquire of the LORD.
content_old: 14 The men took because of their provisions, and did not inquire of the LORD.

content: 15 Joshua established friendship with them; he made a pact with them to spare their lives, and the chieftains of the community gave them their oath.
content_old: 15 Joshua established friendship with them; he made a pact with them to spare their lives, and the chieftains of the community gave them their oath.

content: 16 But when three days had passed after they made this pact with them, they learned that they were neighbors, living among them.
content_old: 16 But when three days had passed after they made this pact with them, they learned that they were neighbors, living among them.

content: 17 So the Israelites set out, and on the third day they came to their towns; these towns were Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath-jearim.
content_old: 17 So the Israelites set out, and on the third day they came to their towns; these towns were Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath-jearim.

content: 18 But the Israelites did not attack them, since the chieftains of the community had sworn to them by the LORD, the God of Israel. The whole community muttered against the chieftains,
content_old: 18 But the Israelites did not attack them, since the chieftains of the community had sworn to them by the LORD, the God of Israel. The whole community muttered against the chieftains,

content: 19 but all the chieftains answered the whole community, “We swore to them by the LORD, the God of Israel; therefore we cannot touch them.
content_old: 19 but all the chieftains answered the whole community, “We swore to them by the LORD, the God of Israel; therefore we cannot touch them.

content: 20 This is what we will do to them: We will spare their lives, so that there may be no wrath against us because of the oath that we swore to them.”
content_old: 20 This is what we will do to them: We will spare their lives, so that there may be no wrath against us because of the oath that we swore to them.”

content: 21 And the chieftains declared concerning them, “They shall live!” And they became hewers of wood and drawers of water for the whole community, as the chieftains had decreed concerning them.
content_old: 21 And the chieftains declared concerning them, “They shall live!” And they became hewers of wood and drawers of water for the whole community, as the chieftains had decreed concerning them.

content: 22 Joshua summoned them and spoke to them thus: “Why did you deceive us and tell us you lived very far from us, when in fact you live among us?
content_old: 22 Joshua summoned them and spoke to them thus: “Why did you deceive us and tell us you lived very far from us, when in fact you live among us?

content: 23 Therefore, be accursed! Never shall your descendants cease to be slaves, hewers of wood and drawers of water for the House of my God.”
content_old: 23 Therefore, be accursed! Never shall your descendants cease to be slaves, hewers of wood and drawers of water for the House of my God.”

content: 24 But they replied to Joshua, “You see, your servants had heard that the LORD your God had promised His servant Moses to give you the whole land and to wipe out all the inhabitants of the country on your account; so we were in great fear for our lives on your account. That is why we did this thing.
content_old: 24 But they replied to Joshua, “You see, your servants had heard that the LORD your God had promised His servant Moses to give you the whole land and to wipe out all the inhabitants of the country on your account; so we were in great fear for our lives on your account. That is why we did this thing.

content: 25 And now we are at your mercy; do with us what you consider right and proper.”
content_old: 25 And now we are at your mercy; do with us what you consider right and proper.”

content: 26 And he did so; he saved them from being killed by the Israelites.
content_old: 26 And he did so; he saved them from being killed by the Israelites.

content: 1 When King Adoni-zedek of Jerusalem learned that Joshua had captured Ai and proscribed it, treating Ai and its king as he had treated Jericho and its king, and that, moreover, the people of Gibeon had come to terms with Israel and remained among them,
content_old: 1 When King Adoni-zedek of Jerusalem learned that Joshua had captured Ai and proscribed it, treating Ai and its king as he had treated Jericho and its king, and that, moreover, the people of Gibeon had come to terms with Israel and remained among them,

content: 2 he was very frightened. For Gibeon was a large city, like one of the royal cities—in fact, larger than Ai—and all its men were warriors.
content_old: 2 he was very frightened. For Gibeon was a large city, like one of the royal cities—in fact, larger than Ai—and all its men were warriors.

content: 3 So King Adoni-zedek of Jerusalem sent this message to King Hoham of Hebron, King Piram of Jarmuth, King Japhia of Lachish, and King Debir of Eglon:
content_old: 3 So King Adoni-zedek of Jerusalem sent this message to King Hoham of Hebron, King Piram of Jarmuth, King Japhia of Lachish, and King Debir of Eglon:

content: 4 “Come up and help me defeat Gibeon; for it has come to terms with Joshua and the Israelites.”
content_old: 4 “Come up and help me defeat Gibeon; for it has come to terms with Joshua and the Israelites.”

content: 5 The five Amorite kings—the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, with all their armies—joined forces and marched on Gibeon, and encamped against it and attacked it.
content_old: 5 The five Amorite kings—the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, with all their armies—joined forces and marched on Gibeon, and encamped against it and attacked it.

content: 6 The people of Gibeon thereupon sent this message to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal: “Do not fail your servants; come up quickly and aid us and deliver us, for all the Amorite kings of the hill country have gathered against us.”
content_old: 6 The people of Gibeon thereupon sent this message to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal: “Do not fail your servants; come up quickly and aid us and deliver us, for all the Amorite kings of the hill country have gathered against us.”

content: 7 So Joshua marched up from Gilgal with his whole fighting force, all the trained warriors.
content_old: 7 So Joshua marched up from Gilgal with his whole fighting force, all the trained warriors.

content: 8 The LORD said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, for I will deliver them into your hands; not one of them shall withstand you.”
content_old: 8 The LORD said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, for I will deliver them into your hands; not one of them shall withstand you.”

content: 9 Joshua took them by surprise, marching all night from Gilgal.
content_old: 9 Joshua took them by surprise, marching all night from Gilgal.

content: 10 The LORD threw them into a panic before Israel: inflicted a crushing defeat on them at Gibeon, pursued them in the direction of the Beth-horon ascent, and harried them all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.
content_old: 10 The LORD threw them into a panic before Israel: inflicted a crushing defeat on them at Gibeon, pursued them in the direction of the Beth-horon ascent, and harried them all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.

content: 11 While they were fleeing before Israel down the descent from Beth-horon, the LORD hurled huge stones on them from the sky, all the way to Azekah, and they perished; more perished from the hailstones than were killed by the Israelite weapons.
content_old: 11 While they were fleeing before Israel down the descent from Beth-horon, the LORD hurled huge stones on them from the sky, all the way to Azekah, and they perished; more perished from the hailstones than were killed by the Israelite weapons.

content: 12 On that occasion, when the LORD routed the Amorites before the Israelites, Joshua addressed the LORD; he said in the presence of the Israelites: “Stand still, O sun, at Gibeon, O moon, in the Valley of Aijalon!”
content_old: 12 On that occasion, when the LORD routed the Amorites before the Israelites, Joshua addressed the LORD; he said in the presence of the Israelites: “Stand still, O sun, at Gibeon, O moon, in the Valley of Aijalon!”

content: 13 And the sun stood still And the moon halted, While a nation wreaked judgment on its foes —as is written in the Book of Jashar. Thus the sun halted in midheaven, and did not press on to set, for a whole day;
content_old: 13 And the sun stood still And the moon halted, While a nation wreaked judgment on its foes —as is written in the Book of Jashar. Thus the sun halted in midheaven, and did not press on to set, for a whole day;

content: 14 for the LORD fought for Israel. Neither before nor since has there ever been such a day, when the LORD acted on words spoken by a man.
content_old: 14 for the LORD fought for Israel. Neither before nor since has there ever been such a day, when the LORD acted on words spoken by a man.

content: 15 Then Joshua together with all Israel returned to the camp at Gilgal.
content_old: 15 Then Joshua together with all Israel returned to the camp at Gilgal.

content: 16 Meanwhile, those five kings fled and hid in a cave at Makkedah.
content_old: 16 Meanwhile, those five kings fled and hid in a cave at Makkedah.

content: 17 When it was reported to Joshua that the five kings had been found hiding in a cave at Makkedah,
content_old: 17 When it was reported to Joshua that the five kings had been found hiding in a cave at Makkedah,

content: 18 Joshua ordered, “Roll large stones up against the mouth of the cave, and post men over it to keep guard over them.
content_old: 18 Joshua ordered, “Roll large stones up against the mouth of the cave, and post men over it to keep guard over them.

content: 19 But as for the rest of you, don’t stop, but press on the heels of your enemies and harass them from the rear. Don’t let them reach their towns, for the LORD your God has delivered them into your hands.”
content_old: 19 But as for the rest of you, don’t stop, but press on the heels of your enemies and harass them from the rear. Don’t let them reach their towns, for the LORD your God has delivered them into your hands.”

content: 20 When Joshua and the Israelites had finished dealing them a deadly blow, they were wiped out, except for some fugitives who escaped into the fortified towns.
content_old: 20 When Joshua and the Israelites had finished dealing them a deadly blow, they were wiped out, except for some fugitives who escaped into the fortified towns.

content: 21 The whole army returned in safety to Joshua in the camp at Makkedah; no one so much as snarled at the Israelites.
content_old: 21 The whole army returned in safety to Joshua in the camp at Makkedah; no one so much as snarled at the Israelites.

content: 22 And now Joshua ordered, “Open the mouth of the cave, and bring those five kings out of the cave to me.”
content_old: 22 And now Joshua ordered, “Open the mouth of the cave, and bring those five kings out of the cave to me.”

content: 23 This was done. Those five kings—the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon—were brought out to him from the cave.
content_old: 23 This was done. Those five kings—the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon—were brought out to him from the cave.

content: 24 And when the kings were brought out to Joshua, Joshua summoned all the men of Israel and ordered the army officers who had accompanied him, “Come forward and place your feet on the necks of these kings.” They came forward and placed their feet on their necks.
content_old: 24 And when the kings were brought out to Joshua, Joshua summoned all the men of Israel and ordered the army officers who had accompanied him, “Come forward and place your feet on the necks of these kings.” They came forward and placed their feet on their necks.

content: 25 Joshua said to them, “Do not be frightened or dismayed; be firm and resolute. For this is what the LORD is going to do to all the enemies with whom you are at war.”
content_old: 25 Joshua said to them, “Do not be frightened or dismayed; be firm and resolute. For this is what the LORD is going to do to all the enemies with whom you are at war.”

content: 26 After that, Joshua had them put to death and impaled on five stakes, and they remained impaled on the stakes until evening.
content_old: 26 After that, Joshua had them put to death and impaled on five stakes, and they remained impaled on the stakes until evening.

content: 27 At sunset Joshua ordered them taken down from the poles and thrown into the cave in which they had hidden. Large stones were placed over the mouth of the cave, to this very day.
content_old: 27 At sunset Joshua ordered them taken down from the poles and thrown into the cave in which they had hidden. Large stones were placed over the mouth of the cave, to this very day.

content: 28 At that time Joshua captured Makkedah and put it and its king to the sword, proscribing it and every person in it and leaving none that escaped. And he treated the king of Makkedah as he had treated the king of Jericho.
content_old: 28 At that time Joshua captured Makkedah and put it and its king to the sword, proscribing it and every person in it and leaving none that escaped. And he treated the king of Makkedah as he had treated the king of Jericho.

content: 29 From Makkedah, Joshua proceeded with all Israel to Libnah, and he attacked it.
content_old: 29 From Makkedah, Joshua proceeded with all Israel to Libnah, and he attacked it.

content: 30 The LORD delivered it and its king into the hands of Israel; they put it and all the people in it to the sword, letting none escape. And he treated its king as he had treated the king of Jericho.
content_old: 30 The LORD delivered it and its king into the hands of Israel; they put it and all the people in it to the sword, letting none escape. And he treated its king as he had treated the king of Jericho.
