content: 31 From Libnah, Joshua proceeded with all Israel to Lachish; he encamped against it and attacked it.
content_old: 31 From Libnah, Joshua proceeded with all Israel to Lachish; he encamped against it and attacked it.

content: 32 The LORD delivered Lachish into the hands of Israel. They captured it on the second day and put it and all the people in it to the sword, just as they had done to Libnah.
content_old: 32 The LORD delivered Lachish into the hands of Israel. They captured it on the second day and put it and all the people in it to the sword, just as they had done to Libnah.

content: 33 At that time King Horam of Gezer marched to the help of Lachish; but Joshua defeated him and his army, letting none of them escape.
content_old: 33 At that time King Horam of Gezer marched to the help of Lachish; but Joshua defeated him and his army, letting none of them escape.

content: 34 From Lachish, Joshua proceeded with all Israel to Eglon; they encamped against it and attacked it.
content_old: 34 From Lachish, Joshua proceeded with all Israel to Eglon; they encamped against it and attacked it.

content: 35 They captured it on the same day and put it to the sword, proscribing all the people that were in it, as they had done to Lachish.
content_old: 35 They captured it on the same day and put it to the sword, proscribing all the people that were in it, as they had done to Lachish.

content: 36 From Eglon, Joshua marched with all Israel to Hebron and attacked it.
content_old: 36 From Eglon, Joshua marched with all Israel to Hebron and attacked it.

content: 37 They captured it and put it, its king, and all its towns, and all the people that were in it, to the sword. He let none escape, proscribing it and all the people in it, just as he had done in the case of Eglon.
content_old: 37 They captured it and put it, its king, and all its towns, and all the people that were in it, to the sword. He let none escape, proscribing it and all the people in it, just as he had done in the case of Eglon.

content: 38 Joshua and all Israel with him then turned back to Debir and attacked it.
content_old: 38 Joshua and all Israel with him then turned back to Debir and attacked it.

content: 39 He captured it and its king and all its towns. They put them to the sword and proscribed all the people in it. They let none escape; just as they had done to Hebron, and as they had done to Libnah and its king, so they did to Debir and its king.
content_old: 39 He captured it and its king and all its towns. They put them to the sword and proscribed all the people in it. They let none escape; just as they had done to Hebron, and as they had done to Libnah and its king, so they did to Debir and its king.

content: 40 Thus Joshua conquered the whole country: the hill country, the Negeb, the Shephelah, and the slopes, with all their kings; he let none escape, but proscribed everything that breathed—as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded.
content_old: 40 Thus Joshua conquered the whole country: the hill country, the Negeb, the Shephelah, and the slopes, with all their kings; he let none escape, but proscribed everything that breathed—as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded.

content: 41 Joshua conquered them from Kadesh-barnea to Gaza, all the land of Goshen, and up to Gibeon.
content_old: 41 Joshua conquered them from Kadesh-barnea to Gaza, all the land of Goshen, and up to Gibeon.

content: 42 All those kings and their lands were conquered by Joshua at a single stroke, for the LORD, the God of Israel, fought for Israel.
content_old: 42 All those kings and their lands were conquered by Joshua at a single stroke, for the LORD, the God of Israel, fought for Israel.

content: 1 When the news reached King Jabin of Hazor, he sent messages to King Jobab of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph,
content_old: 1 When the news reached King Jabin of Hazor, he sent messages to King Jobab of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph,

content: 2 and to the other kings in the north—in the hill country, in the Arabah south of Chinnereth, in the lowlands, and in the district of Dor on the west;
content_old: 2 and to the other kings in the north—in the hill country, in the Arabah south of Chinnereth, in the lowlands, and in the district of Dor on the west;

content: 3 to the Canaanites in the east and in the west; to the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, and Jebusites in the hill country; and to the Hivites at the foot of Hermon, in the land of Mizpah.
content_old: 3 to the Canaanites in the east and in the west; to the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, and Jebusites in the hill country; and to the Hivites at the foot of Hermon, in the land of Mizpah.

content: 4 They took the field with all their armies—an enormous host, as numerous as the sands on the seashore—and a vast multitude of horses and chariots.
content_old: 4 They took the field with all their armies—an enormous host, as numerous as the sands on the seashore—and a vast multitude of horses and chariots.

content: 5 All these kings joined forces; they came and encamped together at the Waters of Merom to give battle to Israel.
content_old: 5 All these kings joined forces; they came and encamped together at the Waters of Merom to give battle to Israel.

content: 6 But the LORD said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them; tomorrow at this time I will have them all lying slain before Israel. You shall hamstring their horses and burn their chariots.��
content_old: 6 But the LORD said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them; tomorrow at this time I will have them all lying slain before Israel. You shall hamstring their horses and burn their chariots.��

content: 7 So Joshua, with all his fighting men, came upon them suddenly at the Waters of Merom, and pounced upon them.
content_old: 7 So Joshua, with all his fighting men, came upon them suddenly at the Waters of Merom, and pounced upon them.

content: 8 The LORD delivered them into the hands of Israel, and they defeated them and pursued them all the way to Great Sidon and Misrephothmaim, and all the way to the Valley of Mizpeh on the east; they crushed them, letting none escape.
content_old: 8 The LORD delivered them into the hands of Israel, and they defeated them and pursued them all the way to Great Sidon and Misrephothmaim, and all the way to the Valley of Mizpeh on the east; they crushed them, letting none escape.

content: 9 And Joshua dealt with them as the LORD had ordered him; he hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots.
content_old: 9 And Joshua dealt with them as the LORD had ordered him; he hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots.

content: 10 Joshua then turned back and captured Hazor and put her king to the sword.—Hazor was formerly the head of all those kingdoms.—
content_old: 10 Joshua then turned back and captured Hazor and put her king to the sword.—Hazor was formerly the head of all those kingdoms.—

content: 11 They proscribed and put to the sword every person in it. Not a soul survived, and Hazor itself was burned down.
content_old: 11 They proscribed and put to the sword every person in it. Not a soul survived, and Hazor itself was burned down.

content: 12 Joshua captured all those royal cities and their kings. He put them to the sword; he proscribed them in accordance with the charge of Moses, the servant of the LORD.
content_old: 12 Joshua captured all those royal cities and their kings. He put them to the sword; he proscribed them in accordance with the charge of Moses, the servant of the LORD.

content: 13 However, all those towns that are still standing on their mounds were not burned down by Israel; it was Hazor alone that Joshua burned down.
content_old: 13 However, all those towns that are still standing on their mounds were not burned down by Israel; it was Hazor alone that Joshua burned down.

content: 14 The Israelites kept all the spoil and cattle of the rest of those cities as booty. But they cut down their populations with the sword until they exterminated them; they did not spare a soul.
content_old: 14 The Israelites kept all the spoil and cattle of the rest of those cities as booty. But they cut down their populations with the sword until they exterminated them; they did not spare a soul.

content: 15 Just as the LORD had commanded His servant Moses, so Moses had charged Joshua, and so Joshua did; he left nothing undone of all that the LORD had commanded Moses.
content_old: 15 Just as the LORD had commanded His servant Moses, so Moses had charged Joshua, and so Joshua did; he left nothing undone of all that the LORD had commanded Moses.

content: 16 Joshua conquered the whole of this region: the hill country , the Negeb, the whole land of Goshen, the Shephelah, the Arabah, and the hill country and coastal plain of Israel—
content_old: 16 Joshua conquered the whole of this region: the hill country , the Negeb, the whole land of Goshen, the Shephelah, the Arabah, and the hill country and coastal plain of Israel—

content: 17 from Mount Halak, which ascends to Seir, all the way to Baal-gad in the Valley of the Lebanon at the foot of Mount Hermon; and he captured all the kings there and executed them.
content_old: 17 from Mount Halak, which ascends to Seir, all the way to Baal-gad in the Valley of the Lebanon at the foot of Mount Hermon; and he captured all the kings there and executed them.

content: 18 Joshua waged war with all those kings over a long period.
content_old: 18 Joshua waged war with all those kings over a long period.

content: 19 Apart from the Hivites who dwelt in Gibeon, not a single city made terms with the Israelites; all were taken in battle.
content_old: 19 Apart from the Hivites who dwelt in Gibeon, not a single city made terms with the Israelites; all were taken in battle.

content: 20 For it was the LORD’s doing to stiffen their hearts to give battle to Israel, in order that they might be proscribed without quarter and wiped out, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
content_old: 20 For it was the LORD’s doing to stiffen their hearts to give battle to Israel, in order that they might be proscribed without quarter and wiped out, as the LORD had commanded Moses.

content: 21 At that time, Joshua went and wiped out the Anakites from the hill country, from Hebron, Debir, and Anab, from the entire hill country of Judah, and from the entire hill country of Israel; Joshua proscribed them and their towns.
content_old: 21 At that time, Joshua went and wiped out the Anakites from the hill country, from Hebron, Debir, and Anab, from the entire hill country of Judah, and from the entire hill country of Israel; Joshua proscribed them and their towns.

content: 22 No Anakites remained in the land of the Israelites; but some remained in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod.
content_old: 22 No Anakites remained in the land of the Israelites; but some remained in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod.

content: 1 The following are the local kings whom the Israelites defeated and whose territories they took possession of: East of the Jordan, from the Wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon, including the eastern half of the Arabah:
content_old: 1 The following are the local kings whom the Israelites defeated and whose territories they took possession of: East of the Jordan, from the Wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon, including the eastern half of the Arabah:

content: 2 King Sihon of the Amorites, who resided in Heshbon and ruled over part of Gilead—from Aroer on the bank of the Wadi Arnon and the wadi proper up to the Wadi Jabbok the border of the Ammonites—
content_old: 2 King Sihon of the Amorites, who resided in Heshbon and ruled over part of Gilead—from Aroer on the bank of the Wadi Arnon and the wadi proper up to the Wadi Jabbok the border of the Ammonites—

content: 3 and over the eastern Arabah up to the Sea of Chinnereth and, southward by way of Beth-jeshimoth at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah on the east, down to the Sea of the Arabah, that is, the Dead Sea.
content_old: 3 and over the eastern Arabah up to the Sea of Chinnereth and, southward by way of Beth-jeshimoth at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah on the east, down to the Sea of the Arabah, that is, the Dead Sea.

content: 4 Also the territory of King Og of Bashan—one of the last of the Rephaim—who resided in Ashtaroth and in Edrei
content_old: 4 Also the territory of King Og of Bashan—one of the last of the Rephaim—who resided in Ashtaroth and in Edrei

content: 5 and ruled over Mount Hermon, Salcah, and all of Bashan up to the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, as also over part of Gilead the border of King Sihon of Heshbon.
content_old: 5 and ruled over Mount Hermon, Salcah, and all of Bashan up to the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, as also over part of Gilead the border of King Sihon of Heshbon.

content: 6 These were vanquished by Moses, the servant of the LORD, and the Israelites; and Moses, the servant of the LORD, assigned that territory as a possession to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
content_old: 6 These were vanquished by Moses, the servant of the LORD, and the Israelites; and Moses, the servant of the LORD, assigned that territory as a possession to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

content: 7 And the following are the local kings whom Joshua and the Israelites defeated on the west side of the Jordan—from Baal-gad in the Valley of the Lebanon to Mount Halak, which ascends to Seir—which Joshua assigned as a possession to the tribal divisions of Israel:

content: 1 Joshua was now old, advanced in years. The LORD said to him, “You have grown old, you are advanced in years; and very much of the land still remains to be taken possession of.
content_old: 1 Joshua was now old, advanced in years. The LORD said to him, “You have grown old, you are advanced in years; and very much of the land still remains to be taken possession of.

content: 2 This is the territory that remains: all the districts of the Philistines and all those of the Geshurites,
content_old: 2 This is the territory that remains: all the districts of the Philistines and all those of the Geshurites,

content: 3 from the Shihor, which is close to Egypt, to the territory of Ekron on the north, are accounted Canaanite, namely, those of the five lords of the Philistines—the Gazites, the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites, and the Ekronites—and those of the Avvim
content_old: 3 from the Shihor, which is close to Egypt, to the territory of Ekron on the north, are accounted Canaanite, namely, those of the five lords of the Philistines—the Gazites, the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites, and the Ekronites—and those of the Avvim

content: 4 on the south; further, all the Canaanite country from Mearah of the Sidonians to Aphek at the Amorite border
content_old: 4 on the south; further, all the Canaanite country from Mearah of the Sidonians to Aphek at the Amorite border

content: 5 and the land of the Gebalites, with the whole Lebanon, from Baal-gad at the foot of Mount Hermon to Lebo-hamath on the east,
content_old: 5 and the land of the Gebalites, with the whole Lebanon, from Baal-gad at the foot of Mount Hermon to Lebo-hamath on the east,

content: 6 with all the inhabitants of the hill country from the Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim, namely, all the Sidonians. I Myself will dispossess those nations for the Israelites; you have only to apportion their lands by lot among Israel, as I have commanded you.
content_old: 6 with all the inhabitants of the hill country from the Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim, namely, all the Sidonians. I Myself will dispossess those nations for the Israelites; you have only to apportion their lands by lot among Israel, as I have commanded you.

content: 7 Therefore, divide this territory into hereditary portions for the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.”
content_old: 7 Therefore, divide this territory into hereditary portions for the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.”

content: 8 Now the Reubenites and the Gadites, along with the other halftribe, had already received the shares which Moses assigned to them on the east side of the Jordan—as assigned to them by Moses the servant of the LORD:
content_old: 8 Now the Reubenites and the Gadites, along with the other halftribe, had already received the shares which Moses assigned to them on the east side of the Jordan—as assigned to them by Moses the servant of the LORD:

content: 9 from Aroer on the edge of the Wadi Arnon and the town in the middle of the wadi, the entire Tableland from Medeba to Dibon,
content_old: 9 from Aroer on the edge of the Wadi Arnon and the town in the middle of the wadi, the entire Tableland from Medeba to Dibon,

content: 10 embracing all the towns of King Sihon of the Amorites, who had reigned in Heshbon, up to the border of the Ammonites;
content_old: 10 embracing all the towns of King Sihon of the Amorites, who had reigned in Heshbon, up to the border of the Ammonites;

content: 11 further, Gilead, the territories of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and all of Mount Hermon, and the whole of Bashan up to Salcah—
content_old: 11 further, Gilead, the territories of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and all of Mount Hermon, and the whole of Bashan up to Salcah—

content: 12 the entire kingdom of Og, who had reigned over Bashan at Ashtaroth and at Edrei. He was the last of the remaining Rephaim. These were defeated and dispossessed by Moses;
content_old: 12 the entire kingdom of Og, who had reigned over Bashan at Ashtaroth and at Edrei. He was the last of the remaining Rephaim. These were defeated and dispossessed by Moses;

content: 13 but the Israelites failed to dispossess the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and Geshur and Maacath remain among Israel to this day.
content_old: 13 but the Israelites failed to dispossess the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and Geshur and Maacath remain among Israel to this day.

content: 14 No hereditary portion, however, was assigned to the tribe of Levi, their portion being the fire offerings of the LORD, the God of Israel, as He spoke concerning them.
content_old: 14 No hereditary portion, however, was assigned to the tribe of Levi, their portion being the fire offerings of the LORD, the God of Israel, as He spoke concerning them.

content: 15 And so Moses assigned to the tribe of the Reubenites, for their various clans,
content_old: 15 And so Moses assigned to the tribe of the Reubenites, for their various clans,

content: 16 and it became theirs: The territory from Aroer, on the edge of the Wadi Arnon and the town in the middle of the wadi, up to Medeba—the entire Tableland—
content_old: 16 and it became theirs: The territory from Aroer, on the edge of the Wadi Arnon and the town in the middle of the wadi, up to Medeba—the entire Tableland—

content: 17 Heshbon and all its towns in the Tableland: Dibon, Bamoth-baal, Beth-baal-meon,
content_old: 17 Heshbon and all its towns in the Tableland: Dibon, Bamoth-baal, Beth-baal-meon,

content: 18 Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,
content_old: 18 Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,

content: 19 Kiriathaim, Sibmah, and Zereth-shahar in the hill of the valley,
content_old: 19 Kiriathaim, Sibmah, and Zereth-shahar in the hill of the valley,

content: 20 Beth-peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth—
content_old: 20 Beth-peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth—

content: 21 all the towns of the Tableland and the entire kingdom of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who had reigned in Heshbon. For Moses defeated him and the Midianite chiefs Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who had dwelt in the land as princes of Sihon.
content_old: 21 all the towns of the Tableland and the entire kingdom of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who had reigned in Heshbon. For Moses defeated him and the Midianite chiefs Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who had dwelt in the land as princes of Sihon.

content: 22 Together with the others that they slew, the Israelites put Balaam son of Beor, the augur, to the sword.
content_old: 22 Together with the others that they slew, the Israelites put Balaam son of Beor, the augur, to the sword.

content: 23 The boundary of the Reubenites was the edge of the Jordan. That was the portion of the Reubenites for their various clans—those towns with their villages.
content_old: 23 The boundary of the Reubenites was the edge of the Jordan. That was the portion of the Reubenites for their various clans—those towns with their villages.

content: 24 To the tribe of Gad, for the various Gadite clans, Moses assigned,
content_old: 24 To the tribe of Gad, for the various Gadite clans, Moses assigned,

content: 25 and it became their territory: Jazer, all the towns of Gilead, part of the country of the Ammonites up to Aroer, which is close to Rabbah,
content_old: 25 and it became their territory: Jazer, all the towns of Gilead, part of the country of the Ammonites up to Aroer, which is close to Rabbah,

content: 26 and from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Lidbir;
content_old: 26 and from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Lidbir;

content: 27 and in the Valley, Beth-haram, Beth-nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon—the rest of the kingdom of Sihon, the king of Heshbon—down to the edge of the Jordan and up to the tip of the Sea of Chinnereth on the east side of the Jordan.
content_old: 27 and in the Valley, Beth-haram, Beth-nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon—the rest of the kingdom of Sihon, the king of Heshbon—down to the edge of the Jordan and up to the tip of the Sea of Chinnereth on the east side of the Jordan.

content: 28 That was the portion of the Gadites, for their various clans—those towns with their villages.
content_old: 28 That was the portion of the Gadites, for their various clans—those towns with their villages.

content: 29 And to the half-tribe of Manasseh Moses assigned so that it went to the half-tribe of Manasseh, for its various clans,
content_old: 29 And to the half-tribe of Manasseh Moses assigned so that it went to the half-tribe of Manasseh, for its various clans,

content: 30 and became their territory: Mahanaim, all of Bashan, the entire kingdom of Og, king of Bashan, and all of Havvoth-jair in Bashan, sixty towns;
content_old: 30 and became their territory: Mahanaim, all of Bashan, the entire kingdom of Og, king of Bashan, and all of Havvoth-jair in Bashan, sixty towns;

content: 31 and part of Gilead, and Ashtaroth and Edrei, the royal cities of Og in Bashan, were assigned to the descendants of Machir son of Manasseh—to a part of the descendants of Machir—for their various clans.
content_old: 31 and part of Gilead, and Ashtaroth and Edrei, the royal cities of Og in Bashan, were assigned to the descendants of Machir son of Manasseh—to a part of the descendants of Machir—for their various clans.

content: 32 Those, then, were the portions that Moses assigned in the steppes of Moab, on the east side of the Jordan.
content_old: 32 Those, then, were the portions that Moses assigned in the steppes of Moab, on the east side of the Jordan.

content: 1 And these are the allotments of the Israelites in the land of Canaan, that were apportioned to them by the priest Eleazar, by Joshua son of Nun, and by the heads of the ancestral houses of the Israelite tribes,
content_old: 1 And these are the allotments of the Israelites in the land of Canaan, that were apportioned to them by the priest Eleazar, by Joshua son of Nun, and by the heads of the ancestral houses of the Israelite tribes,

content: 2 the portions that fell to them by lot, as the LORD had commanded through Moses for the nine and a half tribes.
content_old: 2 the portions that fell to them by lot, as the LORD had commanded through Moses for the nine and a half tribes.

content: 3 For the portion of the other two and a half tribes had been assigned to them by Moses on the other side of the Jordan. He had not assigned any portion among them to the Levites;
content_old: 3 For the portion of the other two and a half tribes had been assigned to them by Moses on the other side of the Jordan. He had not assigned any portion among them to the Levites;

content: 4 for whereas the descendants of Joseph constituted two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, the Levites were assigned no share in the land, but only some towns to live in, with the pastures for their livestock and cattle.
content_old: 4 for whereas the descendants of Joseph constituted two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, the Levites were assigned no share in the land, but only some towns to live in, with the pastures for their livestock and cattle.

content: 5 Just as the LORD had commanded Moses, so the Israelites did when they apportioned the land.
content_old: 5 Just as the LORD had commanded Moses, so the Israelites did when they apportioned the land.

content: 6 The Judites approached Joshua at Gilgal, and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him: “You know what instructions the LORD gave at Kadesh-barnea to Moses, the man of God, concerning you and me.
content_old: 6 The Judites approached Joshua at Gilgal, and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him: “You know what instructions the LORD gave at Kadesh-barnea to Moses, the man of God, concerning you and me.

content: 7 I was forty years old when Moses the servant of the LORD sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land, and I gave him a forthright report.
content_old: 7 I was forty years old when Moses the servant of the LORD sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land, and I gave him a forthright report.

content: 8 While my companions who went up with me took the heart out of the people, I was loyal to the LORD my God.
content_old: 8 While my companions who went up with me took the heart out of the people, I was loyal to the LORD my God.

content: 9 On that day, Moses promised on oath, ‘The land on which your foot trod shall be a portion for you and your descendants forever, because you were loyal to the LORD my God.’
content_old: 9 On that day, Moses promised on oath, ‘The land on which your foot trod shall be a portion for you and your descendants forever, because you were loyal to the LORD my God.’

content: 10 Now the LORD has preserved me, as He promised. It is forty-five years since the LORD made this promise to Moses, when Israel was journeying through the wilderness; and here I am today, eighty-five years old.
content_old: 10 Now the LORD has preserved me, as He promised. It is forty-five years since the LORD made this promise to Moses, when Israel was journeying through the wilderness; and here I am today, eighty-five years old.

content: 11 I am still as strong today as on the day that Moses sent me; my strength is the same now as it was then, for battle and for activity.
content_old: 11 I am still as strong today as on the day that Moses sent me; my strength is the same now as it was then, for battle and for activity.

content: 12 So assign to me this hill country as the LORD promised on that day. Though you too heard on that day that Anakites are there and great fortified cities, if only the LORD is with me, I will dispossess them, as the LORD promised.”
content_old: 12 So assign to me this hill country as the LORD promised on that day. Though you too heard on that day that Anakites are there and great fortified cities, if only the LORD is with me, I will dispossess them, as the LORD promised.”

content: 13 So Joshua blessed Caleb son of Jephunneh and assigned Hebron to him as his portion.
content_old: 13 So Joshua blessed Caleb son of Jephunneh and assigned Hebron to him as his portion.

content: 14 Thus Hebron became the portion of Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, as it still is, because he was loyal to the LORD, the God of Israel.—
content_old: 14 Thus Hebron became the portion of Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, as it still is, because he was loyal to the LORD, the God of Israel.—

content: 1 The portion that fell by lot to the various clans of the tribe of Judah lay farthest south, down to the border of Edom, which is the Wilderness of Zin.
content_old: 1 The portion that fell by lot to the various clans of the tribe of Judah lay farthest south, down to the border of Edom, which is the Wilderness of Zin.

content: 2 Their southern boundary began from the tip of the Dead Sea, from the tongue that projects southward.
content_old: 2 Their southern boundary began from the tip of the Dead Sea, from the tongue that projects southward.

content: 3 It proceeded to the south of the Ascent of Akrabbim, passed on to Zin, ascended to the south of Kadesh-barnea, passed on to Hezron, ascended to Addar, and made a turn to Karka.
content_old: 3 It proceeded to the south of the Ascent of Akrabbim, passed on to Zin, ascended to the south of Kadesh-barnea, passed on to Hezron, ascended to Addar, and made a turn to Karka.

content: 4 From there it passed on to Azmon and proceeded to the Wadi of Egypt; and the boundary ran on to the Sea. That shall be your southern boundary.
content_old: 4 From there it passed on to Azmon and proceeded to the Wadi of Egypt; and the boundary ran on to the Sea. That shall be your southern boundary.

content: 5 The boundary on the east was the Dead Sea up to the mouth of the Jordan. On the northern side, the boundary began at the tongue of the Sea at the mouth of the Jordan.
content_old: 5 The boundary on the east was the Dead Sea up to the mouth of the Jordan. On the northern side, the boundary began at the tongue of the Sea at the mouth of the Jordan.

content: 6 The boundary ascended to Beth-hoglah and passed north of Beth-arabah; then the boundary ascended to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.
content_old: 6 The boundary ascended to Beth-hoglah and passed north of Beth-arabah; then the boundary ascended to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.

content: 7 The boundary ascended from the Valley of Achor to Debir and turned north to Gilgal, facing the Ascent of Adummim which is south of the wadi; from there the boundary continued to the waters of En-shemesh and ran on to En-rogel.
content_old: 7 The boundary ascended from the Valley of Achor to Debir and turned north to Gilgal, facing the Ascent of Adummim which is south of the wadi; from there the boundary continued to the waters of En-shemesh and ran on to En-rogel.

content: 8 Then the boundary ascended into the Valley of Ben-hinnom, along the southern flank of the Jebusites—that is, Jerusalem. The boundary then ran up to the top of the hill which flanks the Valley of Hinnom on the west, at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim.
content_old: 8 Then the boundary ascended into the Valley of Ben-hinnom, along the southern flank of the Jebusites—that is, Jerusalem. The boundary then ran up to the top of the hill which flanks the Valley of Hinnom on the west, at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim.

content: 9 From that hilltop the boundary curved to the fountain of the Waters of Nephtoah and ran on to the towns of Mount Ephron; then the boundary curved to Baalah—that is, Kiriath-jearim.
content_old: 9 From that hilltop the boundary curved to the fountain of the Waters of Nephtoah and ran on to the towns of Mount Ephron; then the boundary curved to Baalah—that is, Kiriath-jearim.

content: 10 From Baalah the boundary turned westward to Mount Seir, passed north of the slope of Mount Jearim—that is, Chesalon—descended to Beth-shemesh, and passed on to Timnah.
content_old: 10 From Baalah the boundary turned westward to Mount Seir, passed north of the slope of Mount Jearim—that is, Chesalon—descended to Beth-shemesh, and passed on to Timnah.

content: 11 The boundary then proceeded to the northern flank of Ekron; the boundary curved to Shikkeron, passed on to Mount Baalah, and proceeded to Jabneel; and the boundary ran on to the Sea.
content_old: 11 The boundary then proceeded to the northern flank of Ekron; the boundary curved to Shikkeron, passed on to Mount Baalah, and proceeded to Jabneel; and the boundary ran on to the Sea.

content: 12 And the western boundary was the edge of the Mediterranean Sea. Those were the boundaries of the various clans of the Judites on all sides.
content_old: 12 And the western boundary was the edge of the Mediterranean Sea. Those were the boundaries of the various clans of the Judites on all sides.

content: 13 In accordance with the LORD’s command to Joshua, Caleb son of Jephunneh was given a portion among the Judites, namely, Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron. (Arba was the father of Anak.)
content_old: 13 In accordance with the LORD’s command to Joshua, Caleb son of Jephunneh was given a portion among the Judites, namely, Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron. (Arba was the father of Anak.)

content: 14 Caleb dislodged from there the three Anakites: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, descendants of Anak.
content_old: 14 Caleb dislodged from there the three Anakites: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, descendants of Anak.

content: 15 From there he marched against the inhabitants of Debir—the name of Debir was formerly Kiriath-sepher—
content_old: 15 From there he marched against the inhabitants of Debir—the name of Debir was formerly Kiriath-sepher—

content: 16 and Caleb announced, “I will give my daughter Achsah in marriage to the man who attacks and captures Kiriath-sepher.”

content: 17 His kinsman Othniel the Kenizzite captured it; and Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah in marriage.
content_old: 17 His kinsman Othniel the Kenizzite captured it; and Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah in marriage.

content: 18 When she came to him, she induced him to ask her father for some property. She dismounted from her donkey, and Caleb asked her, “What is the matter?”
content_old: 18 When she came to him, she induced him to ask her father for some property. She dismounted from her donkey, and Caleb asked her, “What is the matter?”

content: 19 She replied, “Give me a present; for you have given me away as Negeb-land; so give me springs of water.” And he gave her Upper and Lower Gulloth.
content_old: 19 She replied, “Give me a present; for you have given me away as Negeb-land; so give me springs of water.” And he gave her Upper and Lower Gulloth.
