content: 1 The portion that fell by lot to the Josephites ran from the Jordan at Jericho—from the waters of Jericho east of the wilderness. From Jericho it ascended through the hill country to Bethel.
content_old: 1 The portion that fell by lot to the Josephites ran from the Jordan at Jericho—from the waters of Jericho east of the wilderness. From Jericho it ascended through the hill country to Bethel.

content: 2 From Bethel it ran to Luz and passed on to the territory of the Archites at Ataroth,
content_old: 2 From Bethel it ran to Luz and passed on to the territory of the Archites at Ataroth,

content: 3 descended westward to the territory of the Japhletites as far as the border of Lower Beth-horon and Gezer, and ran on to the Sea.
content_old: 3 descended westward to the territory of the Japhletites as far as the border of Lower Beth-horon and Gezer, and ran on to the Sea.

content: 4 Thus the Josephites—that is, Manasseh and Ephraim—received their portion.
content_old: 4 Thus the Josephites—that is, Manasseh and Ephraim—received their portion.

content: 5 The territory of the Ephraimites, by their clans, was as follows: The boundary of their portion ran from Atroth-addar on the east to Upper Beth-horon,
content_old: 5 The territory of the Ephraimites, by their clans, was as follows: The boundary of their portion ran from Atroth-addar on the east to Upper Beth-horon,

content: 6 and the boundary ran on to the Sea. And on the north, the boundary proceeded from Michmethath to the east of Taanath-shiloh and passed beyond it up to the east of Janoah;
content_old: 6 and the boundary ran on to the Sea. And on the north, the boundary proceeded from Michmethath to the east of Taanath-shiloh and passed beyond it up to the east of Janoah;

content: 7 from Janoah it descended to Ataroth and Naarath, touched on Jericho, and ran on to the Jordan.
content_old: 7 from Janoah it descended to Ataroth and Naarath, touched on Jericho, and ran on to the Jordan.

content: 8 Westward, the boundary proceeded from Tappuah to the Wadi Kanah and ran on to the Sea. This was the portion of the tribe of the Ephraimites, by their clans,
content_old: 8 Westward, the boundary proceeded from Tappuah to the Wadi Kanah and ran on to the Sea. This was the portion of the tribe of the Ephraimites, by their clans,

content: 9 together with the towns marked off for the Ephraimites within the territory of the Manassites—all those towns with their villages.
content_old: 9 together with the towns marked off for the Ephraimites within the territory of the Manassites—all those towns with their villages.

content: 1 And this is the portion that fell by lot to the tribe of Manasseh—for he was Joseph’s first-born. Since Machir, the first-born of Manasseh and the father of Gilead, was a valiant warrior, Gilead and Bashan were assigned to him.
content_old: 1 And this is the portion that fell by lot to the tribe of Manasseh—for he was Joseph’s first-born. Since Machir, the first-born of Manasseh and the father of Gilead, was a valiant warrior, Gilead and Bashan were assigned to him.

content: 2 And now assignments were made to the remaining Manassites, by their clans: the descendants of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida. Those were the male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, by their clans.
content_old: 2 And now assignments were made to the remaining Manassites, by their clans: the descendants of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida. Those were the male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, by their clans.

content: 3 Now Zelophehad son of Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh had no sons, but only daughters. The names of his daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
content_old: 3 Now Zelophehad son of Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh had no sons, but only daughters. The names of his daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

content: 4 They appeared before the priest Eleazer, Joshua son of Nun, and the chieftains, saying: “The LORD commanded Moses to grant us a portion among our male kinsmen.” So, in accordance with the LORD’s instructions, they were granted a portion among their father’s kinsmen.
content_old: 4 They appeared before the priest Eleazer, Joshua son of Nun, and the chieftains, saying: “The LORD commanded Moses to grant us a portion among our male kinsmen.” So, in accordance with the LORD’s instructions, they were granted a portion among their father’s kinsmen.

content: 5 Ten districts fell to Manasseh, apart from the lands of Gilead and Bashan, which are across the Jordan.
content_old: 5 Ten districts fell to Manasseh, apart from the lands of Gilead and Bashan, which are across the Jordan.

content: 6 Manasseh’s daughters inherited a portion in these together with his sons, while the land of Gilead was assigned to the rest of Manasseh’s descendants.
content_old: 6 Manasseh’s daughters inherited a portion in these together with his sons, while the land of Gilead was assigned to the rest of Manasseh’s descendants.

content: 7 The boundary of Manasseh ran from Asher to Michmethath, which lies near Shechem. The boundary continued to the right, toward the inhabitants of En-tappuah.—
content_old: 7 The boundary of Manasseh ran from Asher to Michmethath, which lies near Shechem. The boundary continued to the right, toward the inhabitants of En-tappuah.—

content: 8 The region of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh; but Tappuah, on the border of Manasseh, belonged to the Ephraimites.—
content_old: 8 The region of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh; but Tappuah, on the border of Manasseh, belonged to the Ephraimites.—

content: 9 Then the boundary descended to the Wadi Kanah. Those towns to the south of the wadi belonged to Ephraim as an enclave among the towns of Manasseh. The boundary of Manasseh lay north of the wadi and ran on to the Sea.
content_old: 9 Then the boundary descended to the Wadi Kanah. Those towns to the south of the wadi belonged to Ephraim as an enclave among the towns of Manasseh. The boundary of Manasseh lay north of the wadi and ran on to the Sea.

content: 10 What lay to the south belonged to Ephraim, and what lay to the north belonged to Manasseh, with the Sea as its boundary. was contiguous with Asher on the north and with Issachar on the east.
content_old: 10 What lay to the south belonged to Ephraim, and what lay to the north belonged to Manasseh, with the Sea as its boundary. was contiguous with Asher on the north and with Issachar on the east.

content: 11 Within Issachar and Asher, Manasseh possessed Beth-shean and its dependencies, Ibleam and its dependencies, the inhabitants of Dor and its dependencies, the inhabitants of En-dor and its dependencies, the inhabitants of Taanach and its dependencies, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its dependencies: these constituted three regions.
content_old: 11 Within Issachar and Asher, Manasseh possessed Beth-shean and its dependencies, Ibleam and its dependencies, the inhabitants of Dor and its dependencies, the inhabitants of En-dor and its dependencies, the inhabitants of Taanach and its dependencies, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its dependencies: these constituted three regions.

content: 12 The Manassites could not dispossess these towns, and the Canaanites stubbornly remained in this region.
content_old: 12 The Manassites could not dispossess these towns, and the Canaanites stubbornly remained in this region.

content: 13 When the Israelites became stronger, they imposed tribute on the Canaanites; but they did not dispossess them.
content_old: 13 When the Israelites became stronger, they imposed tribute on the Canaanites; but they did not dispossess them.

content: 14 The Josephites complained to Joshua, saying, “Why have you assigned as our portion a single allotment and a single district, seeing that we are a numerous people whom the LORD has blessed so greatly?”
content_old: 14 The Josephites complained to Joshua, saying, “Why have you assigned as our portion a single allotment and a single district, seeing that we are a numerous people whom the LORD has blessed so greatly?”

content: 15 “If you are a numerous people,” Joshua answered them, “go up to the forest country and clear an area for yourselves there, in the territory of the Perizzites and the Rephaim, seeing that you are cramped in the hill country of Ephraim.”
content_old: 15 “If you are a numerous people,” Joshua answered them, “go up to the forest country and clear an area for yourselves there, in the territory of the Perizzites and the Rephaim, seeing that you are cramped in the hill country of Ephraim.”

content: 16 “The hill country is not enough for us,” the Josephites replied, “and all the Canaanites who live in the valley area have iron chariots, both those in Beth-shean and its dependencies and those in the Valley of Jezreel.”
content_old: 16 “The hill country is not enough for us,” the Josephites replied, “and all the Canaanites who live in the valley area have iron chariots, both those in Beth-shean and its dependencies and those in the Valley of Jezreel.”

content: 17 But Joshua declared to the House of Joseph, to Ephraim and Manasseh, “You are indeed a numerous people, possessed of great strength; you shall not have one allotment only.
content_old: 17 But Joshua declared to the House of Joseph, to Ephraim and Manasseh, “You are indeed a numerous people, possessed of great strength; you shall not have one allotment only.

content: 1 The whole community of the Israelite people assembled at Shiloh, and set up the Tent of Meeting there. The land was now under their control;
content_old: 1 The whole community of the Israelite people assembled at Shiloh, and set up the Tent of Meeting there. The land was now under their control;

content: 2 but there remained seven tribes of the Israelites which had not yet received their portions.
content_old: 2 but there remained seven tribes of the Israelites which had not yet received their portions.

content: 3 So Joshua said to the Israelites, “How long will you be slack about going and taking possession of the land which the LORD, the God of your fathers, has assigned to you?
content_old: 3 So Joshua said to the Israelites, “How long will you be slack about going and taking possession of the land which the LORD, the God of your fathers, has assigned to you?

content: 4 Appoint three men of each tribe; I will send them out to go through the country and write down a description of it for purposes of apportionment, and then come back to me.
content_old: 4 Appoint three men of each tribe; I will send them out to go through the country and write down a description of it for purposes of apportionment, and then come back to me.

content: 5 They shall divide it into seven parts—Judah shall remain by its territory in the south, and the house of Joseph shall remain by its territory in the north.—
content_old: 5 They shall divide it into seven parts—Judah shall remain by its territory in the south, and the house of Joseph shall remain by its territory in the north.—

content: 6 When you have written down the description of the land in seven parts, bring it here to me. Then I will cast lots for you here before the LORD our God.
content_old: 6 When you have written down the description of the land in seven parts, bring it here to me. Then I will cast lots for you here before the LORD our God.

content: 7 For the Levites have no share among you, since the priesthood of the LORD is their portion; and Gad and Reuben and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received the portions which were assigned to them by Moses the servant of the LORD, on the eastern side of the Jordan.”
content_old: 7 For the Levites have no share among you, since the priesthood of the LORD is their portion; and Gad and Reuben and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received the portions which were assigned to them by Moses the servant of the LORD, on the eastern side of the Jordan.”

content: 8 The men set out on their journeys. Joshua ordered the men who were leaving to write down a description of the land—“Go, traverse the country and write down a description of it. Then return to me, and I will cast lots for you here at Shiloh before the LORD.”
content_old: 8 The men set out on their journeys. Joshua ordered the men who were leaving to write down a description of the land—“Go, traverse the country and write down a description of it. Then return to me, and I will cast lots for you here at Shiloh before the LORD.”

content: 9 So the men went and traversed the land; they described it in a document, town by town, in seven parts, and they returned to Joshua in the camp at Shiloh.
content_old: 9 So the men went and traversed the land; they described it in a document, town by town, in seven parts, and they returned to Joshua in the camp at Shiloh.

content: 10 Joshua cast lots for them at Shiloh before the LORD, and there Joshua apportioned the land among the Israelites according to their divisions.
content_old: 10 Joshua cast lots for them at Shiloh before the LORD, and there Joshua apportioned the land among the Israelites according to their divisions.

content: 11 The lot of the tribe of the Benjaminites, by their clans, came out first. The territory which fell to their lot lay between the Judites and the Josephites.
content_old: 11 The lot of the tribe of the Benjaminites, by their clans, came out first. The territory which fell to their lot lay between the Judites and the Josephites.

content: 12 The boundary on their northern rim began at the Jordan; the boundary ascended to the northern flank of Jericho, ascended westward into the hill country and ran on to the Wilderness of Beth-aven.
content_old: 12 The boundary on their northern rim began at the Jordan; the boundary ascended to the northern flank of Jericho, ascended westward into the hill country and ran on to the Wilderness of Beth-aven.

content: 13 From there the boundary passed on southward to Luz, to the flank of Luz—that is, Bethel; then the boundary descended to Atroth-addar to the hill south of Lower Beth-horon.
content_old: 13 From there the boundary passed on southward to Luz, to the flank of Luz—that is, Bethel; then the boundary descended to Atroth-addar to the hill south of Lower Beth-horon.

content: 14 The boundary now turned and curved onto the western rim; and the boundary ran southward from the hill on the south side of Beth-horon till it ended at Kiriath-baal—that is, Kiriath-jearim—a town of the Judites. That was the western rim.
content_old: 14 The boundary now turned and curved onto the western rim; and the boundary ran southward from the hill on the south side of Beth-horon till it ended at Kiriath-baal—that is, Kiriath-jearim—a town of the Judites. That was the western rim.

content: 15 The southern rim: From the outskirts of Kiriath-jearim, the boundary passed westward and ran on to the fountain of the Waters of Nephtoah.
content_old: 15 The southern rim: From the outskirts of Kiriath-jearim, the boundary passed westward and ran on to the fountain of the Waters of Nephtoah.

content: 16 Then the boundary descended to the foot of the hill by the Valley of Ben-hinnom at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim; then it ran down the Valley of Hinnom along the southern flank of the Jebusites to En-rogel.
content_old: 16 Then the boundary descended to the foot of the hill by the Valley of Ben-hinnom at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim; then it ran down the Valley of Hinnom along the southern flank of the Jebusites to En-rogel.

content: 17 Curving northward, it ran on to En-shemesh and ran on to Geliloth, facing the Ascent of Adummim, and descended to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.
content_old: 17 Curving northward, it ran on to En-shemesh and ran on to Geliloth, facing the Ascent of Adummim, and descended to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.

content: 18 It continued northward to the edge of the Arabah and descended into the Arabah.
content_old: 18 It continued northward to the edge of the Arabah and descended into the Arabah.

content: 19 The boundary passed on to the northern flank of Beth-hoglah, and the boundary ended at the northern tongue of the Dead Sea, at the southern end of the Jordan. That was the southern boundary.
content_old: 19 The boundary passed on to the northern flank of Beth-hoglah, and the boundary ended at the northern tongue of the Dead Sea, at the southern end of the Jordan. That was the southern boundary.

content: 20 On their eastern rim, finally, the Jordan was their boundary. That was the portion of the Benjaminites, by their clans, according to its boundaries on all sides.
content_old: 20 On their eastern rim, finally, the Jordan was their boundary. That was the portion of the Benjaminites, by their clans, according to its boundaries on all sides.

content: 21 And the towns of the tribe of the Benjaminites, by its clans, were: Jericho, Beth-hoglah, Emek-keziz,
content_old: 21 And the towns of the tribe of the Benjaminites, by its clans, were: Jericho, Beth-hoglah, Emek-keziz,

content: 22 Beth-arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
content_old: 22 Beth-arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,

content: 23 Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
content_old: 23 Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,

content: 24 Chephar-ammonah, Ophni, and Geba—12 towns, with their villages.
content_old: 24 Chephar-ammonah, Ophni, and Geba—12 towns, with their villages.

content: 25 Also Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
content_old: 25 Also Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,

content: 26 Mizpeh, Chephirah, Mozah,
content_old: 26 Mizpeh, Chephirah, Mozah,

content: 27 Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
content_old: 27 Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,

content: 1 The second lot fell to Simeon. The portion of the tribe of the Simeonites, by their clans, lay inside the portion of the Judites.
content_old: 1 The second lot fell to Simeon. The portion of the tribe of the Simeonites, by their clans, lay inside the portion of the Judites.

content: 2 Their portion comprised: Beer-sheba—or Sheba—Moladah,
content_old: 2 Their portion comprised: Beer-sheba—or Sheba—Moladah,

content: 3 Hazar-shual, Balah, Ezem,
content_old: 3 Hazar-shual, Balah, Ezem,

content: 4 Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
content_old: 4 Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,

content: 5 Ziklag, Beth-marcaboth, Hazarsusah,
content_old: 5 Ziklag, Beth-marcaboth, Hazarsusah,

content: 6 Beth-lebaoth, and Sharuhen—13 towns, with their villages.
content_old: 6 Beth-lebaoth, and Sharuhen—13 towns, with their villages.

content: 7 Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan: 4 towns, with their villages—
content_old: 7 Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan: 4 towns, with their villages—

content: 8 together with all the villages in the vicinity of those towns, down to Baalath-beer Ramath-negeb. That was the portion of the tribe of the Simeonites, by their clans.
content_old: 8 together with all the villages in the vicinity of those towns, down to Baalath-beer Ramath-negeb. That was the portion of the tribe of the Simeonites, by their clans.

content: 9 The portion of the Simeonites was part of the territory of the Judites; since the share of the Judites was larger than they needed, the Simeonites received a portion inside their portion.
content_old: 9 The portion of the Simeonites was part of the territory of the Judites; since the share of the Judites was larger than they needed, the Simeonites received a portion inside their portion.

content: 10 The third lot emerged for the Zebulunites, by their clans. The boundary of their portion: Starting at Sarid,
content_old: 10 The third lot emerged for the Zebulunites, by their clans. The boundary of their portion: Starting at Sarid,

content: 11 their boundary ascended westward to Maralah, touching Dabbesheth and touching the wadi alongside Jokneam.
content_old: 11 their boundary ascended westward to Maralah, touching Dabbesheth and touching the wadi alongside Jokneam.

content: 12 And it also ran from Sarid along the eastern side, where the sun rises, past the territory of Chisloth-tabor and on to Daberath and ascended to Japhia.
content_old: 12 And it also ran from Sarid along the eastern side, where the sun rises, past the territory of Chisloth-tabor and on to Daberath and ascended to Japhia.

content: 13 From there it ran to the east, toward the sunrise, to Gath-hepher, to Eth-kazin, and on to Rimmon, where it curved to Neah.
content_old: 13 From there it ran to the east, toward the sunrise, to Gath-hepher, to Eth-kazin, and on to Rimmon, where it curved to Neah.

content: 14 Then it turned—that is, the boundary on the north—to Hannathon. Its extreme limits were the Valley of Iphtah-el,
content_old: 14 Then it turned—that is, the boundary on the north—to Hannathon. Its extreme limits were the Valley of Iphtah-el,

content: 15 Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem: 12 towns, with their villages.
content_old: 15 Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem: 12 towns, with their villages.

content: 16 That was the portion of the Zebulunites by their clans—those towns, with their villages.
content_old: 16 That was the portion of the Zebulunites by their clans—those towns, with their villages.

content: 17 The fourth lot fell to Issachar, the Issacharites by their clans.
content_old: 17 The fourth lot fell to Issachar, the Issacharites by their clans.

content: 18 Their territory comprised: Jezreel, Chesulloth, Shunem,
content_old: 18 Their territory comprised: Jezreel, Chesulloth, Shunem,

content: 19 Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,
content_old: 19 Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,

content: 20 Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,
content_old: 20 Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,

content: 21 Remeth, En-gannim, En-haddah, and Beth-pazzez.
content_old: 21 Remeth, En-gannim, En-haddah, and Beth-pazzez.

content: 22 The boundary touched Tabor, Shahazimah, and Beth-shemesh; and their boundary ran to the Jordan: 16 towns, with their villages.
content_old: 22 The boundary touched Tabor, Shahazimah, and Beth-shemesh; and their boundary ran to the Jordan: 16 towns, with their villages.

content: 23 That was the portion of the tribe of the Issacharites, by their clans—the towns with their villages.
content_old: 23 That was the portion of the tribe of the Issacharites, by their clans—the towns with their villages.

content: 24 The fifth lot fell to the tribe of the Asherites, by their clans.
content_old: 24 The fifth lot fell to the tribe of the Asherites, by their clans.

content: 25 Their boundary ran along Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,
content_old: 25 Their boundary ran along Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,

content: 26 Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal; and it touched Carmel on the west, and Shihorlibnath.
content_old: 26 Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal; and it touched Carmel on the west, and Shihorlibnath.

content: 27 It also ran along the east side to Beth-dagon, and touched Zebulun and the Valley of Iphtah-el to the north, Beth-emek and Neiel; then it ran to Cabul on the north,
content_old: 27 It also ran along the east side to Beth-dagon, and touched Zebulun and the Valley of Iphtah-el to the north, Beth-emek and Neiel; then it ran to Cabul on the north,

content: 28 Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, up to Great Sidon.
content_old: 28 Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, up to Great Sidon.

content: 29 The boundary turned to Ramah and on to the fortified city of Tyre; then the boundary turned to Hosah and it ran on westward to Mehebel, Achzib,
content_old: 29 The boundary turned to Ramah and on to the fortified city of Tyre; then the boundary turned to Hosah and it ran on westward to Mehebel, Achzib,

content: 30 Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob: 22 towns, with their villages.
content_old: 30 Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob: 22 towns, with their villages.

content: 31 That was the portion of the tribe of the Asherites, by their clans—those towns, with their villages.
content_old: 31 That was the portion of the tribe of the Asherites, by their clans—those towns, with their villages.

content: 32 The sixth lot fell to the Naphtalites, the Naphtalites by their clans.
content_old: 32 The sixth lot fell to the Naphtalites, the Naphtalites by their clans.

content: 33 Their boundary ran from Heleph, Elon-bezaanannim, Adami-nekeb, and Jabneel to Lakkum, and it ended at the Jordan.
content_old: 33 Their boundary ran from Heleph, Elon-bezaanannim, Adami-nekeb, and Jabneel to Lakkum, and it ended at the Jordan.

content: 34 The boundary then turned westward to Aznoth-tabor and ran from there to Hukok. It touched Zebulun on the south, and it touched Asher on the west, and Judah at the Jordan on the east.
content_old: 34 The boundary then turned westward to Aznoth-tabor and ran from there to Hukok. It touched Zebulun on the south, and it touched Asher on the west, and Judah at the Jordan on the east.

content: 35 Its fortified towns were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,
content_old: 35 Its fortified towns were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,

content: 36 Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
content_old: 36 Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,

content: 37 Kedesh, Edrei, En-hazor,
content_old: 37 Kedesh, Edrei, En-hazor,

content: 38 Iron, Migdal-el, Horem, Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh: 19 towns, with their villages.
content_old: 38 Iron, Migdal-el, Horem, Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh: 19 towns, with their villages.

content: 39 That was the portion of the tribe of the Naphtalites, by their clans—the towns, with their villages.
content_old: 39 That was the portion of the tribe of the Naphtalites, by their clans—the towns, with their villages.

content: 40 The seventh lot fell to the tribe of the Danites, by their clans.
content_old: 40 The seventh lot fell to the tribe of the Danites, by their clans.

content: 41 Their allotted territory comprised: Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir-shemesh,
content_old: 41 Their allotted territory comprised: Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir-shemesh,

content: 42 Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
content_old: 42 Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,

content: 43 Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
content_old: 43 Elon, Timnah, Ekron,

content: 44 Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
content_old: 44 Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,

content: 45 Jehud, Bene-berak, Gath-rimmon,
content_old: 45 Jehud, Bene-berak, Gath-rimmon,

content: 46 Me-jarkon, and Rakkon, at the border near Joppa.
content_old: 46 Me-jarkon, and Rakkon, at the border near Joppa.

content: 47 But the territory of the Danites slipped from their grasp. So the Danites migrated and made war on Leshem. They captured it and put it to the sword; they took possession of it and settled in it. And they changed the name of Leshem to Dan, after their ancestor Dan.
content_old: 47 But the territory of the Danites slipped from their grasp. So the Danites migrated and made war on Leshem. They captured it and put it to the sword; they took possession of it and settled in it. And they changed the name of Leshem to Dan, after their ancestor Dan.

content: 48 That was the portion of the tribe of the Danites, by their clans—those towns, with their villages.
content_old: 48 That was the portion of the tribe of the Danites, by their clans—those towns, with their villages.

content: 49 When they had finished allotting the land by its boundaries, the Israelites gave a portion in their midst to Joshua son of Nun.
content_old: 49 When they had finished allotting the land by its boundaries, the Israelites gave a portion in their midst to Joshua son of Nun.

content: 50 At the command of the LORD they gave him the town that he asked for, Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim; he fortified the town and settled in it.
content_old: 50 At the command of the LORD they gave him the town that he asked for, Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim; he fortified the town and settled in it.

content: 1 When they had finished dividing the land, the LORD said to Joshua:
content_old: 1 When they had finished dividing the land, the LORD said to Joshua:

content: 2 “Speak to the Israelites: Designate the cities of refuge—about which I commanded you through Moses—
content_old: 2 “Speak to the Israelites: Designate the cities of refuge—about which I commanded you through Moses—

content: 3 to which a manslayer who kills a person by mistake, unintentionally, may flee. They shall serve you as a refuge from the blood avenger.
content_old: 3 to which a manslayer who kills a person by mistake, unintentionally, may flee. They shall serve you as a refuge from the blood avenger.

content: 4 He shall flee to one of those cities, present himself at the entrance to the city gate, and plead his case before the elders of that city; and they shall admit him into the city and give him a place in which to live among them.
content_old: 4 He shall flee to one of those cities, present himself at the entrance to the city gate, and plead his case before the elders of that city; and they shall admit him into the city and give him a place in which to live among them.

content: 5 Should the blood avenger pursue him, they shall not hand the manslayer over to him, since he killed the other person without intent and had not been his enemy in the past.
content_old: 5 Should the blood avenger pursue him, they shall not hand the manslayer over to him, since he killed the other person without intent and had not been his enemy in the past.

content: 6 He shall live in that city until he can stand trial before the assembly, until the death of the high priest who is in office at that time. Thereafter, the manslayer may go back to his home in his own town, to the town from which he fled.”
content_old: 6 He shall live in that city until he can stand trial before the assembly, until the death of the high priest who is in office at that time. Thereafter, the manslayer may go back to his home in his own town, to the town from which he fled.”

content: 7 So they set aside Kedesh in the hill country of Naphtali in Galilee, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron—in the hill country of Judah.
content_old: 7 So they set aside Kedesh in the hill country of Naphtali in Galilee, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron—in the hill country of Judah.

content: 8 And across the Jordan, east of Jericho, they assigned Bezer in the wilderness, in the Tableland, from the tribe of Reuben; Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad; and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.
content_old: 8 And across the Jordan, east of Jericho, they assigned Bezer in the wilderness, in the Tableland, from the tribe of Reuben; Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad; and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.

content: 1 The heads of the ancestral houses of the Levites approached the priest Eleazer, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the ancestral houses of the Israelite tribes,
content_old: 1 The heads of the ancestral houses of the Levites approached the priest Eleazer, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the ancestral houses of the Israelite tribes,

content: 2 and spoke to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, as follows: “The LORD commanded through Moses that we be given towns to live in, along with their pastures for our livestock.”
content_old: 2 and spoke to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, as follows: “The LORD commanded through Moses that we be given towns to live in, along with their pastures for our livestock.”

content: 3 So the Israelites, in accordance with the LORD’s command, assigned to the Levites, out of their own portions, the following towns with their pastures:
content_old: 3 So the Israelites, in accordance with the LORD’s command, assigned to the Levites, out of their own portions, the following towns with their pastures:

content: 4 The lot among the Levites fell to the Kohathite clans. To the descendants of the priest Aaron, there fell by lot 13 towns from the tribe of Judah, the tribe of Simeon, and the tribe of Benjamin;
content_old: 4 The lot among the Levites fell to the Kohathite clans. To the descendants of the priest Aaron, there fell by lot 13 towns from the tribe of Judah, the tribe of Simeon, and the tribe of Benjamin;

content: 5 and to the remaining Kohathites by lot 10 towns from the clans of the tribe of Ephraim, the tribe of Dan, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
content_old: 5 and to the remaining Kohathites by lot 10 towns from the clans of the tribe of Ephraim, the tribe of Dan, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

content: 6 To the Gershonites by lot 13 towns from the clans of the tribe of Issachar, the tribe of Asher, the tribe of Naphtali, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
content_old: 6 To the Gershonites by lot 13 towns from the clans of the tribe of Issachar, the tribe of Asher, the tribe of Naphtali, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.

content: 7 to the Merarites, by their clans—12 towns from the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the tribe of Zebulun.
content_old: 7 to the Merarites, by their clans—12 towns from the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the tribe of Zebulun.

content: 8 The Israelites assigned those towns with their pastures by lot to the Levites—as the LORD had commanded through Moses.
content_old: 8 The Israelites assigned those towns with their pastures by lot to the Levites—as the LORD had commanded through Moses.

content: 9 From the tribe of the Judites and the tribe of the Simeonites were assigned the following towns, which will be listed by name;
content_old: 9 From the tribe of the Judites and the tribe of the Simeonites were assigned the following towns, which will be listed by name;

content: 10 they went to the descendants of Aaron among the Kohathite clans of the Levites, for the first lot had fallen to them.
content_old: 10 they went to the descendants of Aaron among the Kohathite clans of the Levites, for the first lot had fallen to them.

content: 11 To them were assigned in the hill country of Judah Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron—together with the pastures around it.Arba was the father of the Anokites.
content_old: 11 To them were assigned in the hill country of Judah Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron—together with the pastures around it.Arba was the father of the Anokites.

content: 12 They gave the fields and the villages of the town to Caleb son of Jephunneh as his holding.
content_old: 12 They gave the fields and the villages of the town to Caleb son of Jephunneh as his holding.

content: 13 But to the descendants of Aaron the priest they assigned Hebron—the city of refuge for manslayers—together with its pastures, Libnah with its pastures,
content_old: 13 But to the descendants of Aaron the priest they assigned Hebron—the city of refuge for manslayers—together with its pastures, Libnah with its pastures,

content: 14 Jattir with its pastures, Eshtemoa with its pastures,
content_old: 14 Jattir with its pastures, Eshtemoa with its pastures,

content: 15 Holon with its pastures, Debir with its pastures,
content_old: 15 Holon with its pastures, Debir with its pastures,

content: 16 Ain with its pastures, Juttah with its pastures, and Beth-shemesh with its pastures—9 towns from those two tribes.
content_old: 16 Ain with its pastures, Juttah with its pastures, and Beth-shemesh with its pastures—9 towns from those two tribes.

content: 17 And from the tribe of Benjamin: Gibeon with its pastures, Geba with its pastures,
content_old: 17 And from the tribe of Benjamin: Gibeon with its pastures, Geba with its pastures,

content: 18 Anathoth with its pastures, and Almon with its pastures—4 towns.
content_old: 18 Anathoth with its pastures, and Almon with its pastures—4 towns.

content: 19 All the towns of the descendants of the priest Aaron, 13 towns with their pastures.
content_old: 19 All the towns of the descendants of the priest Aaron, 13 towns with their pastures.

content: 20 As for the other clans of the Kohathites, the remaining Levites descended from Kohath, the towns in their lot were: From the tribe of Ephraim
content_old: 20 As for the other clans of the Kohathites, the remaining Levites descended from Kohath, the towns in their lot were: From the tribe of Ephraim

content: 21 they were given, in the hill country of Ephraim, Shechem—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, Gezer with its pastures,
content_old: 21 they were given, in the hill country of Ephraim, Shechem—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, Gezer with its pastures,

content: 22 Kibzaim with its pastures, and Beth-horon with its pastures—4 towns.
content_old: 22 Kibzaim with its pastures, and Beth-horon with its pastures—4 towns.

content: 23 From the tribe of Dan, Elteke with its pastures, Gibbethon with its pastures,
content_old: 23 From the tribe of Dan, Elteke with its pastures, Gibbethon with its pastures,

content: 24 Aijalon with its pastures, and Gath-rimmon with its pastures—4 towns.
content_old: 24 Aijalon with its pastures, and Gath-rimmon with its pastures—4 towns.

content: 25 And from the half-tribe of Manasseh, Taanach with its pastures, and Gath-rimmon with its pastures—2 towns.
content_old: 25 And from the half-tribe of Manasseh, Taanach with its pastures, and Gath-rimmon with its pastures—2 towns.

content: 26 All the towns for the remaining clans of the Kohathites came to 10, with their pastures.
content_old: 26 All the towns for the remaining clans of the Kohathites came to 10, with their pastures.

content: 27 To the Gershonites of the levitical clans: From the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, and Beeshterah with its pastures—2 towns.
content_old: 27 To the Gershonites of the levitical clans: From the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, and Beeshterah with its pastures—2 towns.

content: 28 From the tribe of Issachar: Kishion with its pastures, Dobrath with its pastures,
content_old: 28 From the tribe of Issachar: Kishion with its pastures, Dobrath with its pastures,

content: 29 Jarmuth with its pastures, and En-gannim with its pastures—4 towns.
content_old: 29 Jarmuth with its pastures, and En-gannim with its pastures—4 towns.

content: 30 From the tribe of Asher: Mishal with its pastures, Abdon with its pastures,
content_old: 30 From the tribe of Asher: Mishal with its pastures, Abdon with its pastures,

content: 31 Helkath with its pastures, and Rehob with its pastures—4 towns.
content_old: 31 Helkath with its pastures, and Rehob with its pastures—4 towns.

content: 32 From the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, Hammoth-dor with its pastures, and Kartan with its pastures—3 towns.
content_old: 32 From the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, Hammoth-dor with its pastures, and Kartan with its pastures—3 towns.

content: 33 All the towns of the Gershonites, by their clans, came to 13 towns, with their pastures.
content_old: 33 All the towns of the Gershonites, by their clans, came to 13 towns, with their pastures.

content: 34 To the remaining Levites, the clans of the Merarites: From the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam with its pastures, Kartah with its pastures,
content_old: 34 To the remaining Levites, the clans of the Merarites: From the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam with its pastures, Kartah with its pastures,

content: 35 Dimnah with its pastures, and Nahalal with its pastures—4 towns.
content_old: 35 Dimnah with its pastures, and Nahalal with its pastures—4 towns.

content: 36 From the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, Mahanaim with its pastures,
content_old: 36 From the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, Mahanaim with its pastures,

content: 37 Heshbon with its pastures, and Jazer with its pastures—4 towns in all.
content_old: 37 Heshbon with its pastures, and Jazer with its pastures—4 towns in all.

content: 38 All the towns which went by lot to the Merarites, by their clans—the rest of the levitical clans—came to 12 towns.
content_old: 38 All the towns which went by lot to the Merarites, by their clans—the rest of the levitical clans—came to 12 towns.

content: 39 All the towns of the Levites within the holdings of the Israelites came to 48 towns, with their pastures.
content_old: 39 All the towns of the Levites within the holdings of the Israelites came to 48 towns, with their pastures.

content: 40 Thus those towns were assigned, every town with its surrounding pasture; and so it was with all those towns.
content_old: 40 Thus those towns were assigned, every town with its surrounding pasture; and so it was with all those towns.

content: 41 The LORD gave to Israel the whole country which He had sworn to their fathers that He would assign to them; they took possession of it and settled in it.
content_old: 41 The LORD gave to Israel the whole country which He had sworn to their fathers that He would assign to them; they took possession of it and settled in it.

content: 42 The LORD gave them rest on all sides, just as He had promised to their fathers on oath. Not one man of all their enemies withstood them; the LORD delivered all their enemies into their hands.
content_old: 42 The LORD gave them rest on all sides, just as He had promised to their fathers on oath. Not one man of all their enemies withstood them; the LORD delivered all their enemies into their hands.

content: 1 Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,
content_old: 1 Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,

content: 2 and said to them, “You have observed all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded you, and have obeyed me in everything that I commanded you.
content_old: 2 and said to them, “You have observed all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded you, and have obeyed me in everything that I commanded you.

content: 3 You have not forsaken your kinsmen through the long years down to this day, but have faithfully observed the Instruction of the LORD your God.
content_old: 3 You have not forsaken your kinsmen through the long years down to this day, but have faithfully observed the Instruction of the LORD your God.

content: 4 Now the LORD your God has given your kinsmen rest, as He promised them. Therefore turn and go to your homes, to the land of your holdings beyond the Jordan that Moses the servant of the LORD assigned to you.
content_old: 4 Now the LORD your God has given your kinsmen rest, as He promised them. Therefore turn and go to your homes, to the land of your holdings beyond the Jordan that Moses the servant of the LORD assigned to you.

content: 5 But be very careful to fulfill the Instruction and the Teaching that Moses the servant of the LORD enjoined upon you, to love the LORD your God and to walk in all His ways, and to keep His commandments and hold fast to Him, and to serve Him with all your heart and soul.”
content_old: 5 But be very careful to fulfill the Instruction and the Teaching that Moses the servant of the LORD enjoined upon you, to love the LORD your God and to walk in all His ways, and to keep His commandments and hold fast to Him, and to serve Him with all your heart and soul.”

content: 6 Then Joshua blessed them and dismissed them, and they went to their homes.
content_old: 6 Then Joshua blessed them and dismissed them, and they went to their homes.

content: 7 To the one half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had assigned territory in Bashan, and to the other Joshua assigned on the west side of the Jordan, with their kinsmen. Furthermore, when Joshua sent them off to their homes, he blessed them
content_old: 7 To the one half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had assigned territory in Bashan, and to the other Joshua assigned on the west side of the Jordan, with their kinsmen. Furthermore, when Joshua sent them off to their homes, he blessed them

content: 8 and said to them, “Return to your homes with great wealth—with very much livestock, with silver and gold, with copper and iron, and with a great quantity of clothing. Share the spoil of your enemies with your kinsmen.”
content_old: 8 and said to them, “Return to your homes with great wealth—with very much livestock, with silver and gold, with copper and iron, and with a great quantity of clothing. Share the spoil of your enemies with your kinsmen.”

content: 9 So the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh left the Israelites at Shiloh, in the land of Canaan, and made their way back to the land of Gilead, the land of their own holding, which they had acquired by the command of the LORD through Moses.
content_old: 9 So the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh left the Israelites at Shiloh, in the land of Canaan, and made their way back to the land of Gilead, the land of their own holding, which they had acquired by the command of the LORD through Moses.

content: 10 When they came to the region of the Jordan in the land of Canaan, the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an altar there by the Jordan, a great conspicuous altar.
content_old: 10 When they came to the region of the Jordan in the land of Canaan, the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an altar there by the Jordan, a great conspicuous altar.

content: 11 A report reached the Israelites: “The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar opposite the land of Canaan, in the region of the Jordan, across from the Israelites.”
content_old: 11 A report reached the Israelites: “The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar opposite the land of Canaan, in the region of the Jordan, across from the Israelites.”

content: 12 When the Israelites heard this, the whole community of the Israelites assembled at Shiloh to make war on them.
content_old: 12 When the Israelites heard this, the whole community of the Israelites assembled at Shiloh to make war on them.

content: 13 But the Israelites sent the priest Phinehas son of Eleazar to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead,
content_old: 13 But the Israelites sent the priest Phinehas son of Eleazar to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead,

content: 14 accompanied by ten chieftains, one chieftain from each ancestral house of each of the tribes of Israel; they were every one of them heads of ancestral houses of the contingents of Israel.
content_old: 14 accompanied by ten chieftains, one chieftain from each ancestral house of each of the tribes of Israel; they were every one of them heads of ancestral houses of the contingents of Israel.

content: 15 When they came to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead, they spoke to them as follows:
content_old: 15 When they came to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead, they spoke to them as follows:

content: 16 “Thus said the whole community of the LORD: What is this treachery that you have committed this day against the God of Israel, turning away from the LORD, building yourselves an altar and rebelling this day against the LORD!
content_old: 16 “Thus said the whole community of the LORD: What is this treachery that you have committed this day against the God of Israel, turning away from the LORD, building yourselves an altar and rebelling this day against the LORD!

content: 17 Is the sin of Peor, which brought a plague upon the community of the LORD, such a small thing to us? We have not cleansed ourselves from it to this very day;
content_old: 17 Is the sin of Peor, which brought a plague upon the community of the LORD, such a small thing to us? We have not cleansed ourselves from it to this very day;

content: 18 and now you would turn away from the LORD! If you rebel against the LORD today, tomorrow He will be angry with the whole community of Israel.
content_old: 18 and now you would turn away from the LORD! If you rebel against the LORD today, tomorrow He will be angry with the whole community of Israel.

content: 19 If it is because the land of your holding is unclean, cross over into the land of the LORD’s own holding, where the Tabernacle of the LORD abides, and acquire holdings among us. But do not rebel against the LORD, and do not rebel against us by building for yourselves an altar other than the altar of the LORD our God.
content_old: 19 If it is because the land of your holding is unclean, cross over into the land of the LORD’s own holding, where the Tabernacle of the LORD abides, and acquire holdings among us. But do not rebel against the LORD, and do not rebel against us by building for yourselves an altar other than the altar of the LORD our God.

content: 20 When Achan son of Zerah violated the proscription, anger struck the whole community of Israel; he was not the only one who perished for that sin.”
content_old: 20 When Achan son of Zerah violated the proscription, anger struck the whole community of Israel; he was not the only one who perished for that sin.”

content: 21 The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh replied to the heads of the contingents of Israel: They said,
content_old: 21 The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh replied to the heads of the contingents of Israel: They said,

content: 22 “God, the LORD God! God, the LORD God! He knows, and Israel too shall know! If we acted in rebellion or in treachery against the LORD, do not vindicate us this day!
content_old: 22 “God, the LORD God! God, the LORD God! He knows, and Israel too shall know! If we acted in rebellion or in treachery against the LORD, do not vindicate us this day!

content: 23 If we built an altar to turn away from the LORD, if it was to offer burnt offerings or meal offerings upon it, or to present sacrifices of well-being upon it, may the LORD Himself demand.
content_old: 23 If we built an altar to turn away from the LORD, if it was to offer burnt offerings or meal offerings upon it, or to present sacrifices of well-being upon it, may the LORD Himself demand.

content: 24 We did this thing only out of our concern that, in time to come, your children might say to our children, ‘What have you to do with the LORD, the God of Israel?
content_old: 24 We did this thing only out of our concern that, in time to come, your children might say to our children, ‘What have you to do with the LORD, the God of Israel?

content: 25 The LORD has made the Jordan a boundary between you and us, O Reubenites and Gadites; you have no share in the LORD!’ Thus your children might prevent our children from worshiping the LORD.
content_old: 25 The LORD has made the Jordan a boundary between you and us, O Reubenites and Gadites; you have no share in the LORD!’ Thus your children might prevent our children from worshiping the LORD.

content: 26 So we decided to provide for ourselves by building an altar—not for burnt offerings or sacrifices,
content_old: 26 So we decided to provide for ourselves by building an altar—not for burnt offerings or sacrifices,

content: 27 but as a witness between you and us, and between the generations to come—that we may perform the service of the LORD before Him with our burnt offerings, our sacrifices, and our offerings of well-being; and that your children should not say to our children in time to come, ‘You have no share in the LORD.’
content_old: 27 but as a witness between you and us, and between the generations to come—that we may perform the service of the LORD before Him with our burnt offerings, our sacrifices, and our offerings of well-being; and that your children should not say to our children in time to come, ‘You have no share in the LORD.’

content: 28 We reasoned: should they speak thus to us and to our children in time to come, we would reply, ‘See the replica of the LORD’s altar, which our fathers made—not for burnt offerings or sacrifices, but as a witness between you and us.’
content_old: 28 We reasoned: should they speak thus to us and to our children in time to come, we would reply, ‘See the replica of the LORD’s altar, which our fathers made—not for burnt offerings or sacrifices, but as a witness between you and us.’

content: 29 Far be it from us to rebel against the LORD, or to turn away this day from the LORD and build an altar for burnt offerings, meal offerings, and sacrifices other than the altar of the LORD our God which stands before His Tabernacle.”
content_old: 29 Far be it from us to rebel against the LORD, or to turn away this day from the LORD and build an altar for burnt offerings, meal offerings, and sacrifices other than the altar of the LORD our God which stands before His Tabernacle.”

content: 30 When the priest Phinehas and the chieftains of the community—the heads of the contingents of Israel—who were with him heard the explanation given by the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the Manassites, they approved.
content_old: 30 When the priest Phinehas and the chieftains of the community—the heads of the contingents of Israel—who were with him heard the explanation given by the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the Manassites, they approved.

content: 31 The priest Phinehas son of Eleazar said to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the Manassites, “Now we know that the LORD is in our midst, since you have not committed such treachery against the LORD. You have indeed saved the Israelites from punishment by the LORD.”
content_old: 31 The priest Phinehas son of Eleazar said to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the Manassites, “Now we know that the LORD is in our midst, since you have not committed such treachery against the LORD. You have indeed saved the Israelites from punishment by the LORD.”

content: 32 Then the priest Phinehas son of Eleazar and the chieftains returned from the Reubenites and the Gadites in the land of Gilead to the Israelites in the land of Canaan, and gave them their report.
content_old: 32 Then the priest Phinehas son of Eleazar and the chieftains returned from the Reubenites and the Gadites in the land of Gilead to the Israelites in the land of Canaan, and gave them their report.

content: 33 The Israelites were pleased, and the Israelites praised God; and they spoke no more of going to war against them, to ravage the land in which the Reubenites and Gadites dwelt.
content_old: 33 The Israelites were pleased, and the Israelites praised God; and they spoke no more of going to war against them, to ravage the land in which the Reubenites and Gadites dwelt.

content: 1 Much later, after the LORD had given Israel rest from all the enemies around them, and when Joshua was old and well advanced in years,
content_old: 1 Much later, after the LORD had given Israel rest from all the enemies around them, and when Joshua was old and well advanced in years,

content: 2 Joshua summoned all Israel, their elders and commanders, their magistrates and officials, and said to them: “I have grown old and am advanced in years.
content_old: 2 Joshua summoned all Israel, their elders and commanders, their magistrates and officials, and said to them: “I have grown old and am advanced in years.

content: 3 You have seen all that the LORD your God has done to all those nations on your account, for it was the LORD your God who fought for you.
content_old: 3 You have seen all that the LORD your God has done to all those nations on your account, for it was the LORD your God who fought for you.

content: 4 See, I have allotted to you, by your tribes, these nations that still remain, and that of all the nations that I have destroyed, from the Jordan to the Mediterranean Sea in the west.
content_old: 4 See, I have allotted to you, by your tribes, these nations that still remain, and that of all the nations that I have destroyed, from the Jordan to the Mediterranean Sea in the west.

content: 5 The LORD your God Himself will thrust them out on your account and drive them out to make way for you, and you shall possess their land as the LORD your God promised you.
content_old: 5 The LORD your God Himself will thrust them out on your account and drive them out to make way for you, and you shall possess their land as the LORD your God promised you.

content: 6 “But be most resolute to observe faithfully all that is written in the Book of the Teaching of Moses, without ever deviating from it to the right or to the left,
content_old: 6 “But be most resolute to observe faithfully all that is written in the Book of the Teaching of Moses, without ever deviating from it to the right or to the left,

content: 7 and without intermingling with these nations that are left among you. Do not utter the names of their gods or swear by them; do not serve them or bow down to them.
content_old: 7 and without intermingling with these nations that are left among you. Do not utter the names of their gods or swear by them; do not serve them or bow down to them.

content: 8 But hold fast to the LORD your God as you have done to this day.
content_old: 8 But hold fast to the LORD your God as you have done to this day.

content: 9 “The LORD has driven out great, powerful nations on your account, and not a man has withstood you to this day.
content_old: 9 “The LORD has driven out great, powerful nations on your account, and not a man has withstood you to this day.

content: 10 A single man of you would put a thousand to flight, for the LORD your God Himself has been fighting for you, as He promised you.
content_old: 10 A single man of you would put a thousand to flight, for the LORD your God Himself has been fighting for you, as He promised you.

content: 11 For your own sakes, therefore, be most mindful to love the LORD your God.
content_old: 11 For your own sakes, therefore, be most mindful to love the LORD your God.

content: 12 For should you turn away and attach yourselves to the remnant of those nations—to those that are left among you—and intermarry with them, you joining them and they joining you,
content_old: 12 For should you turn away and attach yourselves to the remnant of those nations—to those that are left among you—and intermarry with them, you joining them and they joining you,

content: 13 know for certain that the LORD your God will not continue to drive these nations out before you; they shall become a snare and a trap for you, a scourge to your sides and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land that the LORD your God has given you.
content_old: 13 know for certain that the LORD your God will not continue to drive these nations out before you; they shall become a snare and a trap for you, a scourge to your sides and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land that the LORD your God has given you.

content: 14 “I am now going the way of all the earth. Acknowledge with all your heart and soul that not one of the good things that the LORD your God promised you has failed to happen; they have all come true for you, not a single one has failed.
content_old: 14 “I am now going the way of all the earth. Acknowledge with all your heart and soul that not one of the good things that the LORD your God promised you has failed to happen; they have all come true for you, not a single one has failed.

content: 15 But just as every good thing that the LORD your God promised you has been fulfilled for you, so the LORD can bring upon you every evil thing until He has wiped you off this good land that the LORD your God has given you.
content_old: 15 But just as every good thing that the LORD your God promised you has been fulfilled for you, so the LORD can bring upon you every evil thing until He has wiped you off this good land that the LORD your God has given you.

content: 1 Joshua assembled all the tribes of Israel at Schechem. He summoned Israel’s elders and commanders, magistrates and officers; and they presented themselves before God.
content_old: 1 Joshua assembled all the tribes of Israel at Schechem. He summoned Israel’s elders and commanders, magistrates and officers; and they presented themselves before God.

content: 2 Then Joshua said to all the people, “Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: In olden times, your forefathers—Terah, father of Abraham and father of Nahor—lived beyond the Euphrates and worshiped other gods.
content_old: 2 Then Joshua said to all the people, “Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: In olden times, your forefathers—Terah, father of Abraham and father of Nahor—lived beyond the Euphrates and worshiped other gods.

content: 3 But I took your father Abraham from beyond the Euphrates and led him through the whole land of Canaan and multiplied his offspring. I gave him Isaac,
content_old: 3 But I took your father Abraham from beyond the Euphrates and led him through the whole land of Canaan and multiplied his offspring. I gave him Isaac,

content: 4 and to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Esau the hill country of Seir as his possession, while Jacob and his children went down to Egypt.
content_old: 4 and to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Esau the hill country of Seir as his possession, while Jacob and his children went down to Egypt.

content: 5 “Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt with that I wrought in their midst, after which I freed you—
content_old: 5 “Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt with that I wrought in their midst, after which I freed you—

content: 6 I freed your fathers—from Egypt, and you came to the Sea. But the Egyptians pursued your fathers to the Sea of Reeds with chariots and horsemen.
content_old: 6 I freed your fathers—from Egypt, and you came to the Sea. But the Egyptians pursued your fathers to the Sea of Reeds with chariots and horsemen.

content: 7 They cried out to the LORD, and He put darkness between you and the Egyptians; then He brought the Sea upon them, and it covered them. Your own eyes saw what I did to the Egyptians. “After you had lived a long time in the wilderness,
content_old: 7 They cried out to the LORD, and He put darkness between you and the Egyptians; then He brought the Sea upon them, and it covered them. Your own eyes saw what I did to the Egyptians. “After you had lived a long time in the wilderness,

content: 8 I brought you to the land of the Amorites who lived beyond the Jordan. They gave battle to you, but I delivered them into your hands; I annihilated them for you, and you took possession of their land.
content_old: 8 I brought you to the land of the Amorites who lived beyond the Jordan. They gave battle to you, but I delivered them into your hands; I annihilated them for you, and you took possession of their land.

content: 9 Thereupon Balak son of Zippor, the king of Moab, made ready to attack Israel. He sent for Balaam son of Beor to curse you,
content_old: 9 Thereupon Balak son of Zippor, the king of Moab, made ready to attack Israel. He sent for Balaam son of Beor to curse you,

content: 10 but I refused to listen to Balaam; he had to bless you, and thus I saved you from him.
content_old: 10 but I refused to listen to Balaam; he had to bless you, and thus I saved you from him.

content: 11 “Then you crossed the Jordan and you came to Jericho. The citizens of Jericho and the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and Jebusites fought you, but I delivered them into your hands.
content_old: 11 “Then you crossed the Jordan and you came to Jericho. The citizens of Jericho and the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and Jebusites fought you, but I delivered them into your hands.

content: 12 I sent a plague ahead of you, and it drove them out before you—the two Amorite kings—not by your sword or by your bow.
content_old: 12 I sent a plague ahead of you, and it drove them out before you—the two Amorite kings—not by your sword or by your bow.

content: 13 I have given you a land for which you did not labor and towns which you did not build, and you have settled in them; you are enjoying vineyards and olive groves which you did not plant.
content_old: 13 I have given you a land for which you did not labor and towns which you did not build, and you have settled in them; you are enjoying vineyards and olive groves which you did not plant.

content: 14 “Now, therefore, revere the LORD and serve Him with undivided loyalty; put away the gods that your forefathers served beyond the Euphrates and in Egypt, and serve the LORD.
content_old: 14 “Now, therefore, revere the LORD and serve Him with undivided loyalty; put away the gods that your forefathers served beyond the Euphrates and in Egypt, and serve the LORD.

content: 15 Or, if you are loath to serve the LORD, choose this day which ones you are going to serve—the gods that your forefathers served beyond the Euphrates, or those of the Amorites in whose land you are settled; but I and my household will serve the LORD.”
content_old: 15 Or, if you are loath to serve the LORD, choose this day which ones you are going to serve—the gods that your forefathers served beyond the Euphrates, or those of the Amorites in whose land you are settled; but I and my household will serve the LORD.”

content: 16 In reply, the people declared, “Far be it from us to forsake the LORD and serve other gods!
content_old: 16 In reply, the people declared, “Far be it from us to forsake the LORD and serve other gods!

content: 17 For it was the LORD our God who brought us and our fathers up from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage, and who wrought those wondrous signs before our very eyes, and guarded us all along the way that we traveled and among all the peoples through whose midst we passed.
content_old: 17 For it was the LORD our God who brought us and our fathers up from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage, and who wrought those wondrous signs before our very eyes, and guarded us all along the way that we traveled and among all the peoples through whose midst we passed.

content: 18 And then the LORD drove out before us all the peoples—the Amorites—that inhabited the country. We too will serve the LORD, for He is our God.”
content_old: 18 And then the LORD drove out before us all the peoples—the Amorites—that inhabited the country. We too will serve the LORD, for He is our God.”

content: 19 Joshua, however, said to the people, “You will not be able to serve the LORD, for He is a holy God. He is a jealous God; He will not forgive your transgressions and your sins.
content_old: 19 Joshua, however, said to the people, “You will not be able to serve the LORD, for He is a holy God. He is a jealous God; He will not forgive your transgressions and your sins.

content: 20 If you forsake the LORD and serve alien gods, He will turn and deal harshly with you and make an end of you, after having been gracious to you.”
content_old: 20 If you forsake the LORD and serve alien gods, He will turn and deal harshly with you and make an end of you, after having been gracious to you.”

content: 21 But the people replied to Joshua, “No, we will serve the LORD!”
content_old: 21 But the people replied to Joshua, “No, we will serve the LORD!”

content: 22 Thereupon Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have by your own act chosen to serve the LORD.” “Yes, we are!” they responded.
content_old: 22 Thereupon Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have by your own act chosen to serve the LORD.” “Yes, we are!” they responded.

content: 23 “Then put away the alien gods that you have among you and direct your hearts to the LORD, the God of Israel.”
content_old: 23 “Then put away the alien gods that you have among you and direct your hearts to the LORD, the God of Israel.”

content: 24 And the people declared to Joshua, “We will serve none but the LORD our God, and we will obey none but Him.”
content_old: 24 And the people declared to Joshua, “We will serve none but the LORD our God, and we will obey none but Him.”

content: 25 On that day at Shechem, Joshua made a covenant for the people and he made a fixed rule for them.
content_old: 25 On that day at Shechem, Joshua made a covenant for the people and he made a fixed rule for them.

content: 26 Joshua recorded all this in a book of divine instruction. He took a great stone and set it up at the foot of the oak in the sacred precinct of the LORD;
content_old: 26 Joshua recorded all this in a book of divine instruction. He took a great stone and set it up at the foot of the oak in the sacred precinct of the LORD;

content: 27 and Joshua said to all the people, “See, this very stone shall be a witness against us, for it heard all the words that the LORD spoke to us; it shall be a witness against you, lest you break faith with your God.”
content_old: 27 and Joshua said to all the people, “See, this very stone shall be a witness against us, for it heard all the words that the LORD spoke to us; it shall be a witness against you, lest you break faith with your God.”

content: 28 Joshua then dismissed the people to their allotted portions.
content_old: 28 Joshua then dismissed the people to their allotted portions.

content: 29 After these events, Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died at the age of one hundred and ten years.
content_old: 29 After these events, Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died at the age of one hundred and ten years.

content: 30 They buried him on his own property, at Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
content_old: 30 They buried him on his own property, at Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.

content: 31 Israel served the LORD during the lifetime of Joshua and the lifetime of the elders who lived on after Joshua, and who had experienced all the deeds that the LORD had wrought for Israel.
content_old: 31 Israel served the LORD during the lifetime of Joshua and the lifetime of the elders who lived on after Joshua, and who had experienced all the deeds that the LORD had wrought for Israel.

content: 32 The bones of Joseph, which the Israelites had brought up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem, in the piece of ground which Jacob had bought for a hundred kesitahs from the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, and which had become a heritage of the Josephites.
content_old: 32 The bones of Joseph, which the Israelites had brought up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem, in the piece of ground which Jacob had bought for a hundred kesitahs from the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, and which had become a heritage of the Josephites.
